The borrower is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothing on a wholesale basis and thus stock her business with a much greater variety that will please her customers. In this way she will be able to obtain better earnings, so that she can have better economic stability with her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothing on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Sani's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2011. They are Samuel, Florence, Elizabeth and Eunice. They are an auto mechanic, cosmetician, charcoaler and hairdresser respectively. They reside in the Dansoman community. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Samuel is a 36-years-old auto mechanic. He has 15 years experience in his business. He works 6 days in a week (from Monday to Saturday). He is constantly working to improve on his business capital. This is his 5th loan with ID-Ghana and he is requesting the an amount of GHS 2,000 to buy car batteries to sell to his customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 4,800 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy car batteries to sell to his customers in the community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out repairs and general maintenance on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Dona Af2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DONA AF2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies du quartier et qui font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, nommée Houénoumè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houénoumè est âgée de 53 ans. Houénoumè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Houénoumè est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Houénoumè vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Houénoumè vend des bois de chauffage, des feuilles d'emballage pour akassa( pâte fait à base de maïs) par la méthode distribution depuis dix ans. Houénoumè s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houénoumè sollicite un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DONA AF2.
texts.en: The Dona AF2 group is made up of 3 friends who live in the same area and are part of the same mutual funds groups. The group's representative, Houénoumè, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Houénoumè is 53 years old and did not go to school. Houénoumè is married to Louis. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school. Houénoumè lives with her husband and children. The couple both take care of the household expenses. In order to do this, Houénoumè has been selling firewood and packaging leaves for akassa (a maize paste) via the distribution channel for 10 years. Houénoumè gets her supplies at markets in Benin and Nigeria. In order to satisfy her clientèle and increase her sales and revenue, Houénoumè is requesting a new loan together with the other members of the Dona AF2 group.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Wangninangbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINANGBE 1 est composé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Sonagnon Marguerite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sonagnon Marguerite est âgée de 48 ans. Sonagnon Marguerite n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sonagnon Marguerite est veuve. Sonagnon Marguerite a deux enfants à sa charge. Sonagnon Marguerite vit seule avec les enfants. Sonagnon Marguerite assure seule les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Sonagnon Marguerite vend du riz, du vin de palme et des bassines en aluminium à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Sonagnon Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sonagnon Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE 1, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Wangninangbe 1 group is made up of 3 people who are part of the same mutual funds groups. The group's representative, Sonagnon Marguerite, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Sonagnon Marguerite is 48 years old and did not go to school. Sonagnon Marguerite is a widow and is raising 2 children. Sonagnon Marguerite lives alone with the children and takes care of the household expenses by herself. In order to do this, Sonagnon Marguerite has been selling rice, palm wine and aluminium bowls from her home for 20 years. Sonagnon Marguerite gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her clientèle and increase her sales and revenue, Sonagnon Marguerite is requesting, together with the other members of the Dona AF2 group, a 5th loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm wine and aluminium bowls.

loans.name: Eddy Ricardo

texts.es:
Eddy es un hombre de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, tiene 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama a pesar que no estar cerca a ellos, ya que por diversas circunstancias se separo de su pareja, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eddy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eddy trabaja como maestro constructor, realizando diversas obras, mejoras de viviendas, locales y otras construcciones, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eddy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de tablas de madera, las cuales le servirán de mucho para poder utilizarlas en sus construcciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un empresario de éxito.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 23-year-old young man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. Eddy is separated from his partner, with whom he has two small children he loves even though he is not close to them. Eddy is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who devotes himself completely to helping his children get ahead. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Eddy had to begin working at an early age and was not able to study Civil Engineering like he had hoped to. 

In his free time, Eddy likes to play soccer with his friends and, on special occasions, he cooks the delicious Arroz con Pollo (a chicken and rice dish) to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much dedication and determination, Eddy works as a master builder on a variety of jobs, improving houses, businesses and other buildings. He works about 10 hours a day and believes that he has been successful thus far due to his work ethic and the kind way he treats others. 

Eddy is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support of this loan offered to him to buy wood, which he needs for his work. Eddy will continue working hard toward his dream of becoming the owner of a successful business.

loans.use: to buy wood boards.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 58 years old. She is married and is raising two dependent children. In order to provide the family with all the necessary facilities, Hang started a business buying and selling clothing in the surrounding areas of Reussey Keo district. She has a large number of customers and usually makes a net income of 8 US dollars a day. Hang is applying for a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy a motorcycle to assist her in transporting her clothing to the markets and to use for household purposes. She is awaiting your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her transport her clothing to the markets and to use for household purposes.

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en: Bekmurod is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Being a responsible father, Bekmurod works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send some of his children to school. He has been dedicated for the past 15 years to farming, growing crops and vegetables on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, he works hard from early morning till late evening. Bekmurod would like to develop his business, which is why he is applying for a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject his loan, and he thanks the lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en: Lusik is a very charming woman who lives in her small flat in the Vanadzhor in the region of Lori. She is a widow. Lusik has a small family, a daughter and a son. She lives alone, since her husband is departed, her son is in the Russian Federation, and her daughter is married and lives with her own family. Lusik has a trading business in her small private market. She brings the clothes that she sells from Yerevan, and sometimes from Turkey, in a rented car. She has been in the trading business for about fifteen years, and she has a great deal of experience in this field. She greets customers with a smile, offers them clothes of various sizes and fashions, and offers prices that are as cheap as possible. As a result, Lusik has many regular customers and great income from her business. Lusik wants to have a loan with Kiva and is applying for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy new spring-summer fashion clothes and women’s underwear for resale in her stall. She will be very happy if Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon support her loan.

loans.use: to buy new spring-summer fashion clothes and women’s underwear to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Patrick from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. He is a married father with two children between the ages of 5 and 18 years. His children are attending school. 

Patrick runs a spare parts business. He sells motor oil, transmission oil, brake kits and electric fans. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business from 7 a.m. until 7:30 pm, six days per week. Patrick has experienced an increase in the price of goods that move fast.

Patrick has requested a loan to purchase motor oil, transmission oil, brake kits and electric fans. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open another shop in a different community. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase motor oil, transmission oil, brake kits and electric fans.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar, a 31-year-old, is engaged in agriculture. He married very young and now has two teenage sons. Anar works in purchasing and reselling livestock. The only challenges he is facing is his business today are expensive grass and feed and the poor quality of drugs for the animals, which increases the risk that the animals will die. However, Anar is a diligent and hard-working man, able to overcome these difficulties. The reason he has applied for this loan is to cover the costs of refurbishing his house. He loves his family and wants to create a comfortable living level for them. He promises to repay the money without any delays.

loans.use: to cover the costs of refurbishment of his house.

loans.name: Most's Group

texts.en: This group consists of two members, Vida D. and Vida. One is a seamstress and the other a seller of undergarments, in their community. They have been together from 2011 to date and still doing very well. Vida, 50 years old, is the seamstress. She is married to Herbert, a 55-year-old contractor. She has three children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well. She has been in this business for three years. She works from Mondays to Saturdays. This is her third loan, and she needs GHS 1,000 to buy fabric to sew and sell to customers. She has been able, through her business, to provide her children with quality education. She is grateful to ID Ghana. The borrowers need a total of GHS 1,800 to buy more and to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Muyasarkhon

texts.en: Muyasarkhon is 45 years old. She is married and has six children. She has been running a farming business for 10 years, and she has many regular customers. She lives with husband and children in the house, which was built with the great dedication of her husband’s father. Her house is old, as it was built many years ago, and it needs some repairs. In winter it has excessive heat loss through the windows and doors. She plans to repair all the rooms of her old house. She is applying for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy building materials to repair the house. She awaits your kindness and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her old house.

loans.name: Nazrullo

texts.en:
Nazrullo has a cafe in the center of his region. He started it many years ago because he needed to work and take care of his family. 

After starting the business, the quality of his family's living condition became better. He takes care of the business with his daughters. His working day starts at dawn when he goes to buy the ingredients and continues throughout the day. In his cafe he only provides breakfast and lunch.

Nazrullo wants to improve the service to his customers by buying tables, chairs and accessories to further expand the premises. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 Tajikistani somoni. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and accessories for his cafe

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his produce store.

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour and maize flour to sell, which will help Joseph to generate greater profits, pay school fees for his children and also improve his family’s standard of living. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses.

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to by more cassava flour and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 38-year-old conservative married lady, who asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. Hiyam has no children and she works with her husband at their tourism office where they arrange tour groups inside and outside of Jordan. Now Hiyam is applying for a loan to redecorate the office to attract more customers and work on marketing campaigns to promote their tours.

loans.use: to redecorate the tourism office and work on marketing campaigns.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es: Don Maximiliano vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos los tres hijos menores estudian actualmente y los dos mayores le ayudan en el trabajo de la agricultura,  ya que don Maximiliano se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues vende productos de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles , por esa razón el esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maximiliano lives with his wife and his 5 children. The three younger children are currently in school, and the two older ones help him with his agricultural work. For a number of years, Maximiliano has worked growing corn and beans. With the earnings from his work, he is able to cover the expenses that arise in his household. He has many customers, since he sells products of very good quality and at truly affordable prices. For this reason, he is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, herbicides, etc., so that he can continue with his work and thus provide his family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 47 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is single and has 7 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 25 years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his small retail shop that sells clothes.

To help expand his business, Vincent has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to additionally provide quality services at the center.

Vincent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vincent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Roxana vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13, 12, y 9 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a elaborar y venta de bolis (helado elaborado del jugos de frutas que se congela en bolsitas platicas cerradas) en su lugar de residencia tiene varios años de tener su negocio, tiene mucha clientela pues vende variedad de sabores y a precios muy accesibles, doña Roxana solicita un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración como: frutas, azúcar, colorantes, bolsitas para empaquetar, agua, etc. y así seguir con su negocio para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Roxana lives in her own house with her husband and her three children, who are 13, 12, and 9 years old. They are currently in school. She works preparing and selling "bolis" (frozen treats made from fruit juice frozen in sealed plastic bags). The business is located in her place of residence, and she has operated it for several years. She has many customers, since she sells a variety of flavors at very affordable prices. Roxana is requesting a loan to buy all of the ingredients necessary for making her products, such as fruits, sugar, colorings, water, little bags for packaging, etc. In this way she will continue with her business in order to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruits, sugar, colorings, water, little bags for packaging, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ibadat

texts.en:
Ibadat lives with his wife and four adult children. The scope of his activities is agriculture. He buys a young calf, raises it and sells it for meat purposes. His children help him with the sales. His dream is to increase the income from the business and provide his children with a safe future.

Ibadat applied to VFAC for a loan to purchase calves. The loan will help him implement his plans and have a beneficial effect on the expansion of his activities.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.en: Jurabek lives in a village with his wife. He is 30 years old. The family earns its main income from farming; they cultivate beans and watermelon. In addition to farming, Jurabek would like to get involved in breeding cattle. He has applied for this loan to buy young cattle, and mineral fertilizers for his land. This expansion will significantly increase his agricultural profits, which Jurabek plans to use to buy more cattle in the future.

loans.use: to buy young cattle, and mineral fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr and his family live in the village of Khashtarak which is in Tavush area. He and his wife are devoted parents who take care of three children. They have a son and two daughters; the elder one has recently gotten married and lives separately with her family. Aleksandr and his wife, who is unemployed, have a small and comfortable farm and they do everything together and with pleasure. For many years Aleksandr has worked at the Ijevan Construction Company as a mechanization specialist. But the main income that his family has is from farming, which has given Aleksandr an opportunity to buy new furniture for his house and to organize his elder daughter’s marriage.
On their farm they have two cows, two piglets and ten chickens. Their farm is not a very big one, but his plans and desire to make it rich and profitable is very strong. Nor Horizon knows Aleksandr as a very responsible and accurate person since, he has taken a loan seven times before and has paid them back on time. This time he decided to cooperate with Kiva and he asks for a loan of 350,000 Armenian Drams to buy a young cow. He thinks that this purchase will bring a good profit to his family.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, sugar and salt.
To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as salt and rice to sell, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children so they can complete their studies. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to provide better quality services in his shop.
Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchace more essential commodities such as salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en: Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 43 years old, lives in his own house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife studies Korean at the university and, during her free time, she does part-time work. He himself has been working as a machinist since 1994, and he is considered to be one of the most experienced workers in his employer’s company. He is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy and install a composting toilet in the bathroom. Using composting oil will remove any ugly odor from the atmosphere, reduce water consumption, and have other benefits. Those are the just the few examples of the advantages of a composting toilet. These environmentally-friendly toilets are the main need in households where central sanitation is not available. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy and install a composting toilet.

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya lives in the village of Lchashen, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his wife and son, who is an innate invalid of the second degree. 

Both Hrachyan and his wife are self-employed. They are engaged in farming and agriculture. Hrachya is the herdsman of their village. On their farm they have a large lot of animals, and it is the only source of income for their family. Hrachya has four cows, a calf, 12 sheep, four lambs, two piglets and a horse. Near their house they have a small plot of land where they cultivate tomatoes, carrots and different greens. All the income that they earn from farming they use first of all for their son’s medicines and then for other needs of their family and farm. Hrachya and his wife do their very best to facilitate their son’s life. 

Hrachya asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy three cows in order to increase his farming. He hopes very much that Kiva will support him and help him to better his family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: To buy three cows in order to increase his farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more footwear to sell

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hola desde Perú, les presento a un joven universitario, Hernán  de 25 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad Administración de negocios internacionales  que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Hernán   tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen administrador. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Hernán   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru are sent to you from a young university student, Hernán, who is 25 years old and single with no children. He is a likable student in the  International Business Administration department, who is studying hard to achieve his goals in life. Herrnán's goal is to successfully finish his studies and become a good administrator. With the loan provided to him, he will invest in paying his university fees and buying study supplies that he needs. Hernán is very grateful for the support provided, and he ends by saying that he has a great desire to achieve the goals he has set. He is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay university fees and buy study supplies.

loans.name: Maa Maheswari-3 Group

texts.en:
The Maa Maheswari-3 Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2010 by four poor but active women of Bhawanipatna town of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Padma, a widowed lady aged about 41 years, is one of them. The lady standing on the extreme left in the photo, raising her hand, is Padma. She lives with her one daughter aged 17 and one son aged 25 years. 

Padma has been running a small general store in her locality for the last five years with the help of her husband. She sells general grocery items like rice, sugar, lentils, biscuits, toffees, fuel wood, eggs, etc. Her son is running an egg-selling business with the help of a push cart. Her net monthly income from the existing business is Rs.4,000. 

Padma purchases stock for her business daily from the wholesalers of the town. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase the stock of her business from this loan amount by purchasing  items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, eggs, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing costs and save time as she currently has to refill her stock on a daily basis. 

Padma dreams of taking a permanent cabin in the township on rent to increase the volume of her business and pull some extra income. 

The other three members of the group are Prabhati and Bela running auto repair centers and Saudamini running a Tiffin stall business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Arnulfo Del Transito

texts.es: Arnulfo, de 61 años de edad, originario de Granada, casado, padre de 4 hijos todos mayores de edad. Él se dedica hacer trabajo de topografía pero desde hace 10 años decidió poner su negocio su primera experiencia fue con una pulpería pero después la quito y decidió poner su negocio de venta de bebidas el distribuye por paquetes al pulperías, distribuidoras, misceláneas. Este negocio le ha permitido preparar sus hijos de hecho uno de ellos es periodistas, pues considera que es la mejor herencia que le es puede dejar por eso es que cuida y trabaja duro cada día por mantener el negocio estable pues deseo que todos sus hijos tengan una carrera profesional. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar agua embotellada, jugos, gaseosas, al  por mayor. Desea ofrecer más variedad de bebidas de diferentes marcas.
texts.en:
Arnulfo, who is 61, is a native of Granada. He is married and is the father of 4 children, all adults. He does topographical work, but 10 years ago he decided to set up a business. His first experience was with a grocery store, but later he closed it and decided to set up a business of selling beverages, which he distributes by the pack to grocery stores, distributors, and convenience stores. This business has allowed him to prepare his children -- in fact, one of them is a journalist --  since he considers that the best inheritance that he can leave them is to tend [to the business] and work hard every day to keep the business stable, since he wants all his children to have a professional career. 

He is applying for the loan to buy bottled water, juices, and soft drinks wholesale. He wants to offer a greater variety of beverages of different brands.

loans.use: to buy bottled water, juices, and soft drinks

loans.name: Andriansyah

texts.en:
Andri lives in Bogor, about 2 hours from Jakarta.  The city is known as the city of rain. Andri manages a small shop selling drinking water by the gallon, gas, and mobile phone airtime credit. In the first three months selling mobile phone airtime credit, he felt like he needed more working capital to expand more.

Andri is married and living with three persons living in the house in the family home. His children are all in school. Andri joined Ruma because he wants to increase his income.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff which he values most, Andri sees improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $30 /day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

Andri hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  He’s known as a highly motivated agent. His goal for his business is to expand more and find more business opportunities with Ruma with enough working capital.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer dinámica y muy entusiasta, es conviviente con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia desde donde trabaja a diario para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.Sandra se dedica a la preparacón de refrescos los cuales estan elaborados con las  mejores frutas de la región, aunque su principal producto es la “chicha morada”  elaborada con maíz morado. Atiende todo el día y lo hace desde hace 2 años y gracias al tiempo que lleva en esta actividad ha podido acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que prefieren sus clientes. Eventualmente complementa su negocio con la venta de bebidas gasificadas.Trabaja siempre sola, ya que su labor no requiere de ningún esfuerzo en la atención y lo que le pone feliz es observar a sus clientes degustar con mucho placer las refrescantes bebidas que prepara.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200 para comprar frutas, maíz morado, azúcar y bolsas pequeñas los cuales necesita para continuar desarrollando su trabajo, además comprará gaseosas de diversos sabores.
texts.en:
Sandra, 42 years old, is a dynamic and enthusiastic woman who lives with her husband and two children ages 20 and 16, respectively. Sandra's family lives in a house they own and out of it she runs her juice business in order to offer her family a better quality of life. Sandra makes a living preparing juices from the region's best fruits. Her most popular drink is chicha mirada, made from purple corn. Sandra has been working in this business for two years, and in that time has perfected the recipe that her customers prefer. Eventually, Sandra hopes to expand her business by offering sodas too. Sandra works alone and loves to see her customers enjoying her drinks. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles in order to buy fruit, purple corn, sugar, and small bags that she needs in order to maintain her business. She also plans to invest in various flavors of sodas.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, bags, and other products.

loans.name: Aneka

texts.en:
Aneka runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, household needs, and mobile phone airtime credits. Aneka lives in Bogor, a rural area about two hours from Jakarta.  Aneka is single and living with three persons in the family home. 

Aneka began working with Ruma about one year ago because she wanted to increase her family income as well as to expand her networking. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $30 - $35 /day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Heraclia

texts.es:
Heraclia, de 55 años es una mujer soltera. Ella vive en compañía de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales solo cuida y educa a 2 de ellos en la casa de la comunidad hace 10 años.Los 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura, hicieron que ella logre todos los objetivos que se propone. A pesar de haber terminado, solo primaria. Comenzó a trabajar en un centro experimental de una de las universidades más antiguas del País. Ahí realiza toda variedad de productos lácteos como: queso, yogurt, manjar blanco y sus variantes. También apoya en la crianza de ovejas de raza, pues es conocedora del clima  y los pastos que crece en esta zona. Por su trabajo recibe un sueldo considerable, pues ello le permite tener una vida cómoda. Además de dedicarse a la compra y venta de animales como gallinas, cuyes y ovejas; las cuales enseba y cuida con mucho esmero, “yo siembro el pasto que tienen que comer”, comenta Heraclia, “pues tienen que alimentarse de buena manera”, culmina. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos de cuyes, para la capital del país, cuenta que en fiestas patrias, existe mayor demanda de la carne de este animal.Este es el cuarto crédito con KIVA,y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante.
Herclia; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más cuyes, pues ya tiene muchos pedidos para está temporada.
texts.en: Heraclia is a 55 year old, unmarried woman.  She lives with her five children, and is responsible for the care and education of only two of them.  They have lived in a house in the community for ten years.  In her fifteen years of experience in farming, she achieved all the goals that she put her mind to, despite having only completed primary school.  She began working in a research center at one of the oldest universities in the country.  There, she makes a range of dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, blancmange and its variants.  She also helps breed pedigree sheep since she is knowledgeable about the climate and the grass that grows in the area. She receives a substantial salary for her work and this allows her to have a comfortable life.  In addition, she buys and sells animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and sheep, which she tends to with great care.  “I sow the grass that they have to eat” Heraclia says, “because they have to eat well”.  Now, she has many orders for guinea pigs.  In the nation’s capital, on patriotic holidays, there is a great demand for the meat of this animal.  This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she feels very grateful for the financial support she has received to move forward.  Herclia will invest the requested funds in the purchase of more guinea pigs because she has many orders for this season.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Abigail Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Abigail vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su esposo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Abigail pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, plátanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y también para mejorar su cocina que es donde prepara los alimentos y  asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Abigail lives in a house that she owns, together with her husband. She makes a living selling food such as french fries, fried yuca, empanadas, tamales, etc. from her home. Thanks to this business, Abigail has been able to help her husband pay their family's living expenses. 

Abigail is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients, such as oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all the other ingredients she needs. She also plans to improve her kitchen where the food is prepared. This will help her to maintain her home and pay her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Dúo El Exito Group

texts.es: Dúo el Exito, este grupo esta formado por la señora Irma Leticia ella se dedica a la siembra de milpa desde hace varios años, con el apoyo de su marido ella a salido adelante les agradese por la ayuda brindada con el credito anterior, ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo de milpa.
texts.en: This group, Dúo el Exito (The Success Duo) was formed by Señora Irma Leticia. She has been growing corn for a number of years. With the support of her husband, she has made progress. She is grateful for the help offered by the previous loan. Now she is applying for this loan to purchase seeds and compost to grow corn.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost to grow corn

loans.name: Eli Nehemias

texts.es: Don eli se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografía para luego salir y comercializarla en los comercios que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos ellos estudian actualmente, para don eli su familia es el principal motor para seguir con su trabajo por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comparar los insumos necesarios para seguir con sus cosechas como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y seguir llevando el sustento diario a su familia
texts.en:
Eli has made a living as a farmer for various years. He grows principally corn and beans. When his crops are ready, he stores them in sacks, as pictured in the photo above, to later go out and sell. Eli sells his crops close to where he lives, and with his earnings he is able to cover his household expenses. Eli lives with his wife and four children who are currently studying. His family is Eli's biggest motivation to keep working. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy the supplies he needs to grow his crops such as fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc. This will help him keep providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Aydee

texts.es: Doña vilma de 33 años de edad se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad, vende sus productos en los comercios de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus vetas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos que tienen en su hogar, doña vilma  quiere seguir con su trabajo de agricultora pero no posee de suficiente capital para comprar todo lo necesario para la siembra por esa razón ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder compra todos los insumos necesarios como: semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, herramientas, etc. y asi poder seguir dándole lo necesario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Vilma, 33 years old, has made a living as a farmer for various years. She lives in a house she owns along with her six-year-old son. Vilma sells her products to basic grocery stores near where she lives. With her earnings from this work and with the help of her husband, she is able to cover her family's expenses. 

Vilma wants to keep working in agriculture, but does not have enough capital to buy everything she needs for her crops. She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, tools, etc. This way, Vilma will be able to provide her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, compost, tools, etc.

loans.name: Watiri

texts.en: Watiri describes herself as a determined mother. She operates a dairy farming business. She supplies milk to Nakuru town. She is applying a loan of 33,000 KES which will be used to purchase a water tank for her home. The tank will benefit 7 people and her livestock. The project will take 2 weeks to be completed. Challenges she faces include inadequate finances. This will be her second loan with SMEP DTM with her previous being 250,000 that she successfully paid.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang lives in Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as the city of rain. Endang manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks, drinking water, and mobile phone airtime credit. Endang is single and living with five persons in the family home. Her siblings are all in school. 

Endang joined Ruma six months ago because he wants to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credit.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Endang has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $60 - $90 /day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more and more business opportunities with Ruma, especially increasing his down-liners.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en: Ashkhen lives in village Vosketap in the region of Ararat with her two sons and husband’s retired parents. Ashkhen’s elder son is passing military service, her husband is in the Russian Federation in work abroad and all the family needs are laid on Ashkhen. She perfectly manages farming and agriculture completely alone. She has a nice vegetable garden, which is the main source of income of her family. She cultivates cucumbers, potatoes and tomatoes of a very good sort and she sells them to resellers at a very good price. But her farm is not as rich with animals as her vegetable garden. She has one cow, a pig and ten chickens. She asks for a loan of 1,300 US dollars to buy piglets and seedlings for her vegetable garden. Ashkhen ensures Kiva lenders that if she gets this loan very soon, she will inform about her successes and profit.

loans.use: To buy piglets and seedlings for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 33-year-old, conservative married woman from Morocco. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Nadia is a mother for two kids. Her husband is an interior designer specializing in interior decorations. Nadia sells blankets, bed sheets and cheese to make additional income. She is applying for a loan to buy more milk for making cheese and bring lighter bed covers to sell for summer season.

loans.use: to buy more milk for making cheese and bring lighter bed covers to sell for summer season.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 24 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her nursery and primary school, where she's a teacher by profession. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more furniture and other scholastic materials for the school and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her child. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Agnes, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and other scholastic materials for the school

loans.name: Batool

texts.en: Batool is a 22-year-old single lady; she is the oldest sister for four siblings. Batool is a university student, majoring in finance and banking. She is applying for a loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, household products, and mobile phone airtime credits. Sri lives in Cibubur, a peri-urban area about one hour from Jakarta.  Sri is married and living with fire persons in the family home, including her sons (20 and 9 years old) and a lovely daughter (17 years old).

Sri began working with Ruma in September 2012 because she wanted to increase her family income by running a small stall. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, she hashad around $115 - $120 /day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 48 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chickens. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicks and charcoal to help in the warming of the chicks, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to become a very powerful businesswoman in town. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Ruth, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and charcoal to help in the warming of the chicks

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia, de 59 años es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Martín, con quien tiene 9 hijos, pero solo cuida de 2 de ellas en la casa que heredó de sus padres desde que nació.
Su trabajo se centra en la crianza de vacas, comenta que desde pequeña sus padres criaban vacas de buena calidad. Es así que ella continuó con la tradición familiar. Posee 8 vacas, 4 en producción y las 4 restantes se encuentran preñadas, en temporada de seca. Por esa razón extrae 30 litros de leche diarios. Su ganancia lo recibe a la semana. Pero aparte de ello tiene extensas hectáreas de terreno agrícola donde siembra pastos naturales y frescos para el alimento de sus animales. “La zona donde vivo se caracteriza por ser ganadera, por lo que también arriendo a otras personas los pastos que siembro, es rentable sobre todo en épocas de verano”, afirma. Es por esa razón que ahora desea mejorar sus extensiones de pastos y aumentar más vacas. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo recibido pues podrá mejorar sus ingresos gracias al apoyo financiero. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues siempre trabajo con empeño y honradez.
Dionicia, invertirá los S/.1100 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus plantaciones de pastos naturales para alimento de sus vacas.
texts.en:
Dionicia, who is 59, is a happy and hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, Martín, with whom she has 9 children, but she cares for only 2 of them in the house that she inherited from her parents [and has lived in] since she was born.

Her work centers on raising cows. She comments that since she was little, her parents raised cows of good quality. Thus she continued with the family tradition. She has 8 cows, 4 in production, and the remaining 4 are pregnant and are now dry. For this reason, she collects 30 liters of milk a day. She receives her earnings weekly. But apart from this, she has broad hectares of agricultural land, where she plants natural and fresh pastures to feed her animals. "The zone where I live is characterized by livestock raising, and so I also rent the pastures I plant to other people. It is profitable, especially in the summer,"  she confirms. It is for this reason that now she wants to improve her areas of pasture and increase her number of cows.

This is her first Kiva loan. She is grateful for the support she will receive, since she will be able to improve her income thanks to the financial support. In addition, she promises to be punctual in making her payments, since she always works with effort and integrity. Dionicia will invest the 1100 PEN in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her plantings of natural pasture to feed her cows.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past nine years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her pharmacy which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs to sell, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase her capital so as to have enough health facilities. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a very big residential house for herself. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married mother who describes herself as an honest woman. She keeps livestock for a living and also sells milk in town. Challenges that she faces include inadequate funds to purchase storage facilities. Thus, she is applying for a loan of 21,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) that will be used to purchase tanks for harvesting water for her family and livestock. The estimated time for completion of the project is two weeks. This will be her second application for a loan with SMEP DTM, the previous one being for 20,000 KES.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man. He has five siblings. Mohammad is a university student, majoring in geology. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester's registration fees to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's registration fees

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 24-year-old single lady. She lives with her eight siblings and parents. Nour is proud of herself that she got her bachelor's degree and was able to enroll in a higher degree program. Now she is a master's degree student, majoring in chemistry. Nour is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance  is a 36-year-old woman from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rawandan francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Esperance started selling lights in May, 2012 and she has sold 90 to date, providing clean energy to 450 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband Jean Pierre, and their four children.

loans.use: To buy low-cost LED lights that she will resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty  is   married with three children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has business of market vending and has been in this business for five years, selling on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more   bunches of green bananas, charcoal, tomatoes and onions.  She generates additional income from rental houses.  

Betty works seven days out of every week   at the market. Her major business challenges include the rainy season and defaulters. She is aspiring of building and owning a bigger food stall and also educating her children up to university.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, charcoal, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 24-year-old married lady, her husband is a police officer, and they have one child. Besides taking care of her child and household, Sahar goes to university to study the science of optics at one of the best government universities in Jordan. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester's registration fees, which will allow her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's registration fees

loans.name: Eraste

texts.en:
Eraste is a 46-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Eraste started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 130 lights to date, providing clean energy to 650 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 24-year-old married lady.  Her husband is an accountant. Besides taking care and managing her house, Alaa goes to a governmental university to study nursing. Her passion in helping others has lead her to study nursing where she can do her best with patients.

Now Alaa is applying for an education loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
This is Jean Nepo, who is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 RWF to purchase 10 additional rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village that is located in Rulindo District in Northern Province. These customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

He started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 50 lights to date, 10 of which were fully funded by Kiva. He is now providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Dative, and their 4 children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single guy. He has 2 older siblings.

Ali is a third year law student in a governmental university in the North of Jordan. His plans after graduation are that he would train first at a law firm and start working in the same field after getting enough experience and a practice certificate. But for now Ali is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester registration fees

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is a 39-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Alphonse started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Warda

texts.en: Warda is a 30-year-old divorced lady who has been living in the same neighborhood for the last three years. During these three years, she was able to make friends and build new connections. Using that, she started selling shoes and make-up products at home; she also started doing a hairstyling business at home. Now, she wants to enhance her home business and bring in a few hairstyling tools in hopes that later, she will be able to open her own hairstyling shop.

loans.use: to bring in a few hairstyling tools like a new hairdryer and brushes.

loans.name: Rihan

texts.en: Rihan is a 21-year-old married lady with a husband who works two jobs to support their family, and one son. Besides being a mother, Rihan goes to university to study religion, in particular Islam. Now she is applying for a loan to finish paying for her current semester's fees so that she can take her final exams, and register for the summer semester.

loans.use: to finish paying for her current university fees and register for the summer semester.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is a 21-year-old single lady. She is the oldest sister for five siblings. Heba is a university student majoring in laboratory sciences. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam is a 21-years-old single lady. She has one sister living with her at their parents' house. Salam goes to one of the governmental universities to study languages. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Audelia Cecilia

texts.es:
Audelia, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería negocio que inicio  a los 20 años de edad, su anterior crédito lo utilizo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza para surtir su negocio pues son productos muy demandados por su clientes. Está muy agradecida por brindarle la oportunidad de su primer crédito que ha sido muy positivo para su pulpería.
Hoy está requiriendo el crédito para comprar granos básicos al por mayor tales como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, maíz, trigo y aceite. Ella desea ir surtiendo su pulpería de nuevos productos para atraer más clientes y hacer su negocio crecer cada dia.
texts.en: Audelia is a resident of Grenada.  She is a businessperson and owns a grocery store, a business she started when she was twenty years old.  She used her previous loan to purchase basic grains, oil, and cleaning products to stock her business since there is a high customer demand for these products.  She is very grateful to have been offered the opportunity to receive the first loan as it has been very positive for her business.  Today, she is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale basic grains such as sugar, beans, rice, corn, wheat, and oil.  She wishes to stock her grocery store with new products to attract more customers and make her business grow each day.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale basic grains.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en:
Isaie is a 37-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Isaie started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, Odetha, and their four children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is a 32-year-old woman from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Chantal started selling lights in May 2012 and she has sold 120 lights to date, providing clean energy to 600 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband, and their children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 40-year-old conservative woman; she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. They have a family of five members. Her husband, Emad, works from home making Islamic and geometric template designs to be used for decoration purposes. He mainly uses gypsum material to do so, as well as colors. 

Now, Nelly wants to support her husband’s work and get him more material to start making different shapes of those templates and making more decoration pieces, and for that, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to support her husband’s work and get him more material to start making different shapes of decoration-piece templates.

loans.name: Biserka

texts.en:
Biserka, 64, is a married mother of two adult children. She lives in a minority community part of Kosovo. Her husband is blind, and he is working for a blind association. He is the main source of income, and Biserka receives a small pension. 

Her life was always difficult because her husband never had a chance to help her carry out home and children obligations for daily life. Their income is not enough to renovate her house, which is in unacceptable condition. 

Biserka is in need of a loan to renovate the toilet and walls of the house.

The loan will help to improve their living conditions, which will make an easier life for them. She hopes in the future to have better conditions for her family. She appreciate all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate the toilet and walls.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La cliente Ana vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio desde muy pequeña en donde vendía papelería y así tener ingresos para su hogar. En la actualidad tiene un pequeño negocio de papelería y barzar. 

Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta finalizar la noche. Vende cuadernos, plumas, carpetas, utilices escolares etc. Ella quiere lo mejor para su negocio ya que es su medio de ingresos porque sus hijos ya son mayores de edad. Por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar utlies escolares y poder vender a los padres que necesitan en el sector.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business when she was very little.  She sold stationery items in order to have income for her household.  She currently has a small stationery and variety business.

She works from very early until the end of the evening.  She sells notebooks, pens, folders, and school supplies, etc.  She wants the best for her business because it is her means of getting an income, and her children are now adults.

That is why she wants this loan to buy school supplies and to be able to sell them to the parents in the area who need them.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Branko

texts.en:
Branko is 25 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in a minority community in a southern part of Kosovo. Branko is employed in a municipality, and his wife works in administration. They recently got married, and he wants to do renovation of the house.

Branko is in need of a loan to facade the house. This loan will help them to have a pleasant atmosphere for improving their life conditions. He hopes in the future to have children and to have a big family. His goal is to save money for the future family. 

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to facade his house, where he lives with his new wife.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 26-year-old woman from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

With the support from Kiva, she was able to purchase 10 LED lights for sale to people without electricity in her village. She is now seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Sophia started selling lights in August 2012, and has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. 

She also practices farming and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 34 años, es una responsable madre soltera. Vive desde hace 20 años en la casa de su papá, junto a su hija.Su principal actividad económica se centra en la venta de animales, cuando tiene el capital suficiente realiza compra de toros, vacas, ovejas y demás ejemplares, las que cuida con mucho empeño, ya que su objetivo es engordarlos para venderlos después, a los carniceros que llegan a su zona, le va muy bien en su trabajo, espera que dentro de poco poder aumentar el capital de trabajo para tener buenos ganados, sobre todo en cantidad. Sabe que lo logrará, pues hace 2 meses comenzó con la compra y venta de ropa, de donde obtiene un ingreso económico diario que le permite solventar los gastos económicos del hogar. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero para seguir adelante,  por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Liz, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de más animales como: cuyes para aumentar su ganadería.
texts.en: Liz is 34 years old.  She is a responsible single mother.  For the past twenty years, she has lived in her father’s home, along with her daughter.  Her main economic activity is animal sales.  When she has enough capital, she purchases bulls, cows, sheep, and other specimens.  She cares for them with great effort because her goal is to fatten them for later sale to the butchers that come to the area.  Her job is going very well and shortly, she expects to be able to increase working capital and have good livestock, especially in quantity.  She knows that she will achieve this goal because two months ago, she began buying and selling clothing.  She earns a daily income from this business that allows her to pay the household expenses.  This is her second loan with Kiva and she feels happy to have the financial support to move forward.  For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her payments.  Liz will invest the S/.500 soles in the purchase of more animals such as guinea pigs to increase her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosa De  Jesus

texts.es: Doña rosa de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Rosa, 47, lives in her own house with her husband and her children, ages 13 and 8, who are currently in school.  She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, sugar, and other items.

Rosa has many years of experience in her business, which has given her sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits.  Her business is in her home in a town.  She's very well known among the neighbors in the area.  She has attracted a lot of customers because her store is stocked.

She wants to expand her business and make a new investment.  She needs capital, though, so she's requesting a loan so she can buy what she needs for her store.  She's certain she'll repay the debt and trusts she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La cliente Luz vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó con una pequeña inversión en su tienda, poco a poco fue mejorando y diversificando los víveres que vendía. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 05:30am hasta las 22:00pm todos los dias. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que son el sustento de su hogar ya que no esta casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian es escuelas fiscales. Debido a que no puede capitalizar los estudios de sus hijos con los ingresos de la tienda quiere un préstamo para poder comprar una computadora y asi mejorar la enseñanza de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz lives in Guayaquil.  She started with a small investment in her store.  Little by little she was improving and diversifying the supplies that she sold.  She currently works from 5:30 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day.

She has a lot of aspirations with her business because it supports her household.  She is not married, and she has four children who attend public schools.

Due to the fact that she cannot pay for her children’s education with the income from the store, she wants a loan.  She wants to be able to buy a computer and improve her children’s education this way.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Emma Victoria

texts.es:
La cliente Emma vive en Guayaquil. La cliente es una mujer emprendedora que comenzó su negocio hace 12 años atrás. Poco a poco fue mejorando su tienda hasta ahora que ya tiene surtida y con víveres de primera necesidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 06:00am hasta las 22:00pm. 

En su tienda tiene viveres de primera necesidad, bebidas, enlatados, granos etc. Pero como no tiene como capitalizar los estudios de su hijo de 17 años quiere el prestamo ya que quiere comprar una computadora para que el mejore sus enseñanzas.
texts.en:
Emma lives in Guayaquil.  She is an enterprising woman who started her business 12 years ago.  Little by little she was improving her store.  She now has it stocked with basic needs supplies.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She has basic needs supplies, drinks, canned goods, and grains, etc. in her store.  

However, she does not have a way to pay for her 17 year old son’s education.  She wants the loan because she wants to buy a computer so that her son improves his education.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is a 51-year-old woman from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Eugenie started selling lights in May 2012, and she has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years and married to Shallon. They have four children and two dependents whom he is taking care of due to the death of their father. Moses deals in a cattle-fattening project in his region. He has managed to help his family financially by providing them with the basic necessities. Alongside his business, he also deals in milk sales. He says it helped him a lot to look after his aging mother after the death of his father.

Moses is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more cows for fattening, as it will enable him to look after his family with all the basic necessities of life.

His major challenge is inadequate pastures to feed his cows, especially in the dry season, whereby some of his animals die due to drought. His dream is to own a large farm in his region with at least 500 cows.

Moses is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 38-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Isaac started selling lights in August 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuscene is a 42-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.  

Jean Nepomuscene started selling lights in October 2012, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie business received a boost from the zero-interest loan from Kiva. This loan gave her the start-up capital for the LED light sale and recharging business. 

She completed her first loan in time and is now seeking another loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.  

She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana, de oficio comerciante comparte su agradecimiento con Kiva por brindarle la oportunidad de su primer crédito que le permitió comprar artículos escolares y uniformes de escuela, logro vender los libros, cuadernos, borradores, lapiceros. Ahora quiere diversificar su negocio este financiamiento lo va utilizar para comprar carteras, perfumes, ropas y artículos escolares. El día de las madres está cerca y desea ofrecer de estos productos en su Librería y aprovechar la temporada de ventas y al mismo tiempo conseguir más clientes. Pues su anhelo es expandir su negocio y ampliar cada día mas.
texts.en:
Ana, a shopkeeper, is grateful to Kiva for providing her with her first loan. This loan will allow her to buy school supplies and school uniforms, and sell books, notebooks, erasers and pens. 

Now she wants to diversify her business. She will use this financing to buy backpacks, perfumes, clothes and school supplies. Mother's Day is nearing and she wants to offer these products in her stationery store and take advantage of the sale season and at the same time obtain more customers. 

Her wish is to expand her business and increase every day.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, perfumes, clothes and school supplies.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has three children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and a personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping." His biggest challenge is poultry diseases. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Chebanan.

Cyrus was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because it offers affordable loans to farmers." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Importance of directing loans to the intended projects."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit his family?" Cyrus replied, "Income from the poultry project will help me educate my children and expand my hotel business."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cyrus owns the following: cow, poultry and bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.
