In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sets of fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to repair her existing boat.

loans.use: to purchase additional sets of  fishing nets.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with two adult-age and two school-age children.

Delia  has an internet and rice business and earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to to pay her son's tuition fees.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Channa is aged 53 years and widowed with two children. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her children by farming rice. Having been in the business for 20 years, the current business earns her approximately 26,000 KHR per day.

Channa is with VisionFund for this loan cycle. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use another portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
Clemente is 52 years old and a father of two grown up children. He is an example of a determined man. He has endured 15 years of working under the strong heat of the sun and even heavy rains managing his rice field. Desiring to harvest more sacks of rice, Clemente wants to avail himself of a loan of PHP 20, 000 for him to buy insecticides, fertilizer and seeds which are very essential in his farming activities. Clemente is very 
hopeful that his loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sylviah

texts.en:
Sylviah is a married woman aged 25 years old. She has three kids who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and fees for the family.

She operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall She sells at the market in town to dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, of oranges, bananas and green vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Sangke district, Vith is aged 52 years and married with three children. The main source of her family’s income is from working for others, which she and her husband have been doing for five years to make a living. The current business earns them about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Vith has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her current business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Vith, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy a decent bicycle for commuting to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent bicycle for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy a decent bicycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, zippers, buttons, and more.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is a resident of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 52 years old, married and has one child. Cecile has practiced her profession as a public midwife in her community for 30 years. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to be used to purchase construction materials needed for completing her house. Cecile has been a Paglaum MPC member since 2008.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed to complete her house.

loans.name: Aravoi Group

texts.es:
Aravoi es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Caacupé, son 13 mujeres quienes están muy emocionadas de formar parte de este grupo y emprendimiento, ya que así podrán ayudar a sus familiares e hijos y podrán darles lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Clara es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas, cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que últimamente las prendas de segunda mano son muy solicitadas. Ella cuenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por procurar una mejor vida para ella y su familia, y que no les falte nada.
Ella solicita de este crédito para emplearlo en la compra de prendas de segunda mano para poder venderlas y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en: Aravoi, a communal bank in the city of Caacupé, comprises 13 women, who are very excited to be part of the group and its undertaking, as the women will be able to help their families and children and to perhaps give them what they didn't have. Clara, one of the members, sells used clothing. She says that business is good because lately used clothing is in demand. She says that all her efforts are dedicated to obtaining a better life for herself and her family so that they lack nothing. She has applied for a loan to buy used clothing so that she can continue making sales. She is grateful for the support she and the other members are getting.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y gracias a esto están sabiendo la situación de cada una, donde 8  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien se dedica a la costura y a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas y calzados. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha y se esfuerza por salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a los suyos. Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy capaz, que quiere trabajar y progresar.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de telas, prendas, calzados y demás, para poder invertirlo en ambos oficios  que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The members of the group called "Mujeres Unidas" are from the city of Caaguazú. They are in their third loan cycle in the women's group program, where everyone works and helps one another to succeed. They are doing the survey about poverty elimination, and thanks to this are learning about the situation of each of them. Eight of them are below the poverty line, that is to say with very low income. 

One of the members is Teresa, who does dressmaking and sells all types of products as a street vendor, such as clothing and footwear. She is a very hard-working person who strives and does her best to move forward in life, and to help her family through her work. She defines herself as a very able woman who wants to work and progress.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, articles of clothing, footwear and other items, enabling her to invest in both of her activities. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: To buy fabric, clothing, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Janireh

texts.en: Janireh, 27 years old, is a married entrepreneur with one child from Sicot, Tangub City. He is earning income from a transport service business. He started almost a year ago and earns 7,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. To improve his business, he borrowed 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories, such as tires and a sidecar, for his vehicle. Before long, Janireh is hopeful of the possibility of expanding and improving his transport business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories, such as tires and a sidecar, for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su madre, el e dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, el siembra maíz y maicillo tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos que se le presenta en su hogar. El cliente solicita un crédito para poder compra los insumos necesarios para su cosecha como abonos,  semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y asi obtener mejores ganancia que le ayuden con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: The client lives with his mother and has been a farmer for several years. He grows corn and sorghum and has many customers because he offers a high quality product at affordable prices. He is able to pay household expenses from profits from his sales. The client has applied for a loan to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, and more so that he can increase his profit, which helps pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea is 36 years old and married. She is the mother of two children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for several years and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sochea is with VisionFund for this loan cycle. She is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR from VisionFund. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use another portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Aged 31 years old, Chea is a married mother of four children living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming, and corn and watermelon planting are the main sources of her family’s income, and her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. Chea can earn about KHR2 9,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chea’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village. Chea is the third cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely repaid her past loans, which have enabled her to better support her family. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Chea, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice, corn and watermelon healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Enkhtaivan, 43 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2003, and accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them quickly to their destinations and shortening routes. His wife works as a saleswoman at someone's stall. His two children both go to high school. They have recently built their house, but haven't finished some interior parts. 

Enkhtaivan is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials, such as vacuum-insulated windows, planks, wallpaper and fiberglass. Using those materials, he can finish his house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodations for his family. The newly built house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. Now they live in a Mongolian traditional ger(portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Right after the house is finished being built, Enkhtaivan, together with his family, wants to move into their house. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Chunly

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Chunly is 55 years old and married. She and her husband have five children, two of whom are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava and they have been in this business for almost 37 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 35,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Chunly with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase crop yields and sell for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva el nombre Tajy Poty se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo del programa, cuenta con 16 integrantes actualmente , es un grupo muy responsable, solidario, se ayudan entre sí, agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por ela ayuda que ellas están recibiendo, ya que no solo las integrantes se benefician, sino también sus familias.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Zulma de 38 años, es macatera (Vendedora Ambulante). Ella en compañia de su esposo recorre las ciudades de Ita,Yaguarón todos los fines de semana sin importar la inclemencia del tiempo realizan este trabajo hace 15 años y por medio de este trabajo han logrado ir creciendo poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo honesto.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás, para poder surtirse de buenos productos y seguir con las ventas que hace.
texts.en:
This communal bank of enterprising women is called Tajy Poty. It is in its first loan cycle and is comprised of 16 members. The group is responsible and united, and the members help one another. They thank Fundación Paraguaya for its support, which helps not just the members, but also their families. 

One of the outstanding stories is that of Zulma, 38, who is a street vendor. She and her husband travel to the cities of Ita and Yaguarón every weekend, no matter what the weather is like. They have been working this way for 15 years, and the business has slowly grown, thanks to their honest labor. Zulma has applied for a loan to buy clothing, footwear, bazaar items, and more so that she will have high quality inventory to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, bazaar items, and more to sell.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern, 35, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is married with three children, two of whom are still in school. The family’s main source of income is from planting rice on ten hectares of farmland. Her family’s daily income is about 38,000 KHR per day.
 
Khoern’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and Khoern is in her fifth microloan with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her business with enough food. Now she is leading her group, and wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to earn more income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Veth's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Veth is age 55, and married with seven children. She and her husband are hardworking farmers who make a living through farming rice on four hectares of farmland. To gain more income to better support the family, they also work for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for 31 years.
 
Veth has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles and successfully paid back the past loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her family. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Aty Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerza al máximo por ir mejorando sus vidas. Son mujeres jefas de familia que deciden trabajar duro para poder salir adelante.
Emerita es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, y por medio de ese trabajo está luchando por salir adelante y tener los ingresos que su hogar necesita para mantenerse.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para los cerdos que ella cría, y de esa forma que no les falte nada. Ella y sus compañeras están muy animadas y llena de ilusiones con el comité.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this committee engage in a variety of businesses and each one puts the maximum effort into bettering her life.  These women are the heads of their households, who decided to work hard to achieve success.

Emerita is a very hardworking woman.  She earns her living raising and selling pigs, and through her work she's striving to get ahead and earn the income to support her household.  

She is seeking this loan to buy nutritious feed for the pigs she's raising, so they lack for nothing.  She and her colleagues are very excited and full of hope for the committee.

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed for pigs.

loans.name: Neziver

texts.en: Neziver is 35 years, married and has two children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba. Neziver raises pigs and cows for a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Neziver is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase construction materials needed for home renovation. Neziver has been a member of Paglaum MPC for eight years.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home renovation.

loans.name: Erlindo

texts.en:
Erlindo is 61 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. He is married with 10 adult-age children.

Erlindo has a pig business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. He has requested a loan to  purchase feed for his pigs.

Erlindo has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Erlindo hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 37 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.

Mary Grace has a store that sell goods. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan to to purchase more items for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

Mary Grace has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is married with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City.

To earn a living, Loreta has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 2,000 PHP. 

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for seven years. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase piglets and sacks of starter pellets.

In the future, Loreta hopes to have more savings and investments.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and sacks of starter pellets.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Cesillian

texts.en:
Cesillian, 39, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cesillian has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cesillian requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cesillian has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cesillian would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ressurection Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Laiton from Masvingo. He is married with two children, one of whom attends school. Laiton runs a grocery store business which sells sugar, mealie meal, cooking oil and soap. The business has been in operation for ten years. Laiton says the main challenge he is facing is stiff competion from other traders. 

Laiton has requested a loan of $750 to buy groceries for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to improve his family's welfare. In the future, Laiton plans to buy properties in town.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mealie meal, cooking oil and soap for resale.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business.She is married and she has three children. She is running a second-hand clothing store that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks of clothing to keep in her store, such pants and shorts. She opened her second-hand clothing store a year ago with her own working capital of $200. 

Natalia is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale, such as pants and shorts.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis es de la Ciudad de Mariano R. Alonso, es un joven de 24 años de edad, anteriormente cuenta que trabajaba en una empresa como empleado, pero hace unos meses decidió independizarse y abrió un taller de motos y también repuestos.
El es un joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante, trabaja y quiere ayudar a su familia por medio de ese oficio. El comenta que su sueño es algún día, su nuevo negocio tenga muchas sucursales para tener mayores ingresos y a la vez poder ayudar a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de repuestos para motos y de esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Derlis, 24, lives in Mariano Roque Alonso. Previously he worked for a company, but several months ago he decided to open a motorcycle repair and spare parts shop on his own. He is a young man who desires to succeed and to work and help his family through his profession. He says he dreams of opening many locations for his new business so that his income will increase while helping other people.

He has applied for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts so that he can fill customer orders. He is grateful for the wonderful opportunity he is getting, as it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 55 years old and married with nine children.

Antonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items for resale, such as bread, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., in her general store.

Antonia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Antonia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for resale, such as bread, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Ket's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Ket is 48 years old and the married mother of three children. To deal with the daily cost of living, she manages a one-and-a-half hectare area for rice cropping as the primary source of income. To supplement the family’s income, she also works for others for a fee. 

Ket has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to provide enough food for her children. Now, in a group of five, she is the leader. The total loan amount of her group members is 6,000,000 KHR. For Ket, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, she will spend her loan portion to plow and to lease additional farmland for growing cassava. She hopes that this loan will boost her crop output in a good way and better off her lifestyle.

loans.use: to plow and to lease additional farmland.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: Age 31 and the mother of three kids who are still in school, Channa is a villager from Kampong Cham province. For the sake of her family, the main sources of her income are from rice farming, cassava farming, and firewood selling. This business has returned about 30,700 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Channa with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for both of her cash crops. She highly believes that she will earn more income and expand her business on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for both of her cash crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, salt, flour and other ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 50 years now.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, salt, flour and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ana Albertina

texts.es:
Ana tiene 57 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene seis hijos. Desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar junto a sus padres y hermanos en la agricultura. A los 17 años de edad se caso y procreo sus hijos y con mucho esfuerzo a salido adelante.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, preparar la tierra para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de yuca.  Su propósito, es continuar trabajando y comprar su propio terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
Ana is 57 years old, lives with her partner and has six children. From a young age she has worked with her parents and brothers in agriculture. She married at 17, raised her children, and with a great deal of effort has moved forward in life.

The loan she is applying to Fundación Campo for is to buy fertilizers, manure and prepare the land for growing 1.4 hectares of yuca. Her goal is to continue working and to buy her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure and prepare the land for growing 1.4 hectares of yuca.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.fr: Sabira âgée de 58 ans ne vit plus avec son mari. Sabira a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés. Sabira vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Sabira n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Sabira vend des biscuits et des habits depuis quinze ans. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sabira sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sabira is 58 years old. She is separated from her husband. She has three children, some of whom are in school. Sabira lives together with her children. She did not attend school. In order to provide for herself and her children, Sabira has been selling cookies and clothing for 15 years. In order to meet customer demand, Sabira is seeking financial support from ALIDé for the sixth time. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cookies.

loans.name: Ermilo

texts.en: Ermilo is 39 years old and married with three children living in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He has operated a transportation services business for five years, and he earns 8,000 PHP a month to support his family's needs. In 2009, Ermilo joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP, which he will use to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories to be used for repair and maintenance. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories to be used for repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Mejorando La Economia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mejorando la Economia y está en su ciclo número 2º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo que ellas están haciendo pueden mejorar su economía.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nidia, quien cuenta que tiene un comedor, donde gracias a las delicias que ella hace esta saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona con muchas ganas de crecer y de progresar, es por eso que se esfuerza más y más cada día. Ella cuenta que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar su comedor, pero que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre acude a su negocio.
La Sra. Nidia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para surtir su negocio, como ser verduras, bebidas, etc., lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Improving Economic Status" is in its second loan cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty-elimination study which, thanks to the work they're doing, will be able to improve their financial status.  One of the members is Nidia, who has an eatery that is succeeding because of the delicious food she makes.  She's a person with a great desire to grow and progress, which is why she strives more and more by the day.  She has sacrificed a lot to be able to start her eatery, but now she has good clientele that always frequent her business.

Nidia is seeking a loan to buy ingredients to stock up the eatery, like vegetables, drinks, etc., which will help her make a concrete business plan so she can increase revenue.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her eatery, like vegetables, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Doña Natividad es una mujer con 49 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante. Ella es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales solo una estudia cursando el primer año de secundaria. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que la práctica hace más de 30 años siendo el esposo el que le enseño a trabajar el cultivo y siembra de café, maíz y frijoles. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación debido a que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudar con sus estudios. La tierra que juntos en familia trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a 500 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas son poder cultivar más producto en su tierra ya que esto generara más ingresos para su familia y podrá mejorar su estilo de vida y la de sus hijos los cuales la apoyan enorme mente con las diferentes actividades en el campo.
texts.en:
Natividad, 49, is married, hardworking, and enterprising. She has a great desire to excel and succeed. She is the mother of seven children, of whom only one is still a student and is in the first year of middle school. She has a lot of experience, as she has worked for 30 years with her husband, who taught her how to plant and grow coffee, corn, and beans. She didn't attend school because her parents lacked the financial resources to help her with her studies. The land the family owns and works is 500 metros from the house, and they walk there every day.

Natividad has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop so that the harvest will be healthy and abundant and so that she will generate income and profit to invest in the business. Her goal is to grow more so that she can increase her family's income and improve the lifestyle of her children, who are a tremendous help with the many field chores.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Carmen Idalia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace cinco años se dedica a administrar su propia tienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mercadería para su tienda. Con la inversión espera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que no le son suficientes los que posee actualmente. Su puposito es continuar trabajando muy fuerte para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She has run her own store for five years.

The loan for which she is applying to Fundación Campo is to buy merchandise for her store. With the investment, she hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers, as the stock she has currently is not sufficient. Her goal is to continue working very hard, so that she and her family can move forward in life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and has ten children, four of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Sokly is 29 years old and married. She is blessed with three children, two of whom currently are too young for schooling, while the third attends school. Her entire household relies solely on one business, selling groceries in the local area. For being involved in the current business, she is able to earn up to 22,000 KHR per day. 

Sokly and the joint member in her group of two are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sokly will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her items on time and earn triple income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is 45 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3-children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of that, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Razia, as a member of a two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Razia is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Samoun

texts.en:
Age 47 and a resident from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Samoun is married and blessed with one child who is a student in the local state school. For her child's sake, Samoun cultivates rice and raises pigs as the main source of income. The current business, which she has been involved for 12 years, has returned her about 32,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Samoun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully used her past three loans with success to upgrade her lifestyle in a good way and has fully repaid her past loans. For this loan cycle, she will spend her loan portion in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR to repair her house. She hopes that she can renovate her house on time so she does not need to worry about the upcoming rainy season, especially for her child.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 32 years old and married, is a resident of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She has four children to care for as some of them are in school. On her two-hectare plot of farmland, paddy rice is the only crop that she grows. Besides rice farming, her husband helps to earn additional income via selling firewood. From the current business, which she has been doing since she was 20 years old, Chantha is able to earn up to 15,300 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Chantha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan that she repaid has enabled her to support her business on time. Now she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. Chantha, as the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to support her farming business as well as for commuting. She hopes this purchase will help her to reduce her transportation cost that she used to pay.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to support her farming business as well as for commuting.

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en: Rasheeda lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband is a milk seller. As a member of a two-person group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase milk from a poultry farm and sell it in the market at a profitable price. Rasheeda is thankful to Kiva and hopes that the loan will be effective for her husband's job.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Aydelit

texts.es:
Aydelith, de 43 años de edad, esta casada con  Evacio quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de su hija de 15 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa en compañía de su padre.La actividad que tiene Aydelith  es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas y sabores, además de golosinas. Todos estos productos son adquiridos al contando y son vendidos desde su casa a sus vecinos y transeúntes quienes son sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 06 años dedicándose  éste negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo de su hija quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos que obtiene, además del poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y contar con tiempo disponible para dedicarlos a otras actividades. Considera a su negocio rentable por la demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja.Este será el primer préstamo con KIVA , por tanto espera de su apoyo financiero para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de 500 soles comprará bebidas gasificadas y productos comestibles para poner a la venta.
texts.en:
Aydelith, 43, is married to Evacio, who is a driver and the father of her 15-year-old daughter. They live in their own house with her father. Aydelith sells different brands and flavors of sodas and candies. She pays for all the merchandise in cash and sells from her house to neighbors and passers-by, who are her regular customers. She has run the business for six years, and, for now, her only helper is her daughter, who waits on customers when Aydelith is away from home.

She likes the business because she earns income and is able to operate from the comfort of her house and have time to do other things. The business is profitable with current demand and the income it generates. This will be her first loan cycle with Kiva, and she expects the funding will help her succeed. She will use the loan of 500 soles to buy sodas and food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and food items.

loans.name: Sombon's Group

texts.en:
Sombon is 31 years old and a married mother blessed with three schoolchildren. She is a rice grower and also a rice vendor, while her husband catches fish for sale. In the current business, she is able to earn up to 26,000 KHR per day.  

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in the fifth loan cycle. The past loan ,which she used wisely to support her living and to keep her children in school, has been fully repaid already. Now she is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more rice to stock for resale when prices are high. She hopes to gain a high margin from her business and better off her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock for resale when prices are high.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Age 27 and the mother of two dependent children, Sara is a resident of Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. The two-and-a-half hectares of rice farming are the main source of her family's income. Her husband also helps her to earn extra income by working for others for a fee. The current business has earned her about 30,000 KHR per day.	

Including this loan, she is in the fifth cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She, after the successful loan that she has fully repaid, feels confident that she can upgrade her lifestyle in a good manner. For this cycle, she is applying for 2,000,000 KHR in order to renovate her house. She highly hopes this loan will support her house construction on time.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Winifrida, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been running a beauty salon for five years now.  She works from 8:00am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to replace missing equipment in the salon. She used the profits to repair the salon floor. She has successfully paid back her loan. She will use this loan to increase her stock of salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to send her kids to good schools and to build her own house.

Winifrida will share this loan with her loan group, "ASERNAL", whose members will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of salon equipment.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim is one of the breadwinners in a family which includes three children who are still in school, Sim is a villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. 

She overcomes the family’s financial burdens by rice cropping and pig-raising. She has been involved with the current business for eight years and is able to earn up to 18,900 KHR. In the same group of two, it is the fourth loan for Sim and the second loan for the other member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

She has utilized her past loan in good shape and improved her living status better than before. She has fully repaid back her past loan with success. Now, she is seekingr a loan of 1,100,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 3, 000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pigs, pig feed, and necessary materials to make weaving mats for extra income. She hopes to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pig feed, and necessary materials to make weaving mats for extra income.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: An industrious farmer from Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Sary is 26 years-old and the mother of one little child. She deals with the daily cost of living via rice farming. To better feed the family her husband works for others for a fee through firewood shipping. The five years involvement in the current business has earned her about 15,500 KHR per day. Sary is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline for her mini-tractor and to fix her mini-tractor. She hopes that she can gain more yield from her current business so as she can triple her income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for her mini-tractor and to fix her mini-tractor.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
A 52-year-old widowed mother of three children, Heng is a peasant from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, where her residential area is. Currently, only one child still needs her support as the child is still in school. As a single mother and the breadwinner in the family, Heng sells sweets in the market of the village. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR from the current business, which she has had for ten years. 

This is the third microloan that Heng has obtained from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans that she has repaid with success have enabled her to support her business on time and earn a decent income to provide sufficient meals three times a day for her children. Now she is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 KHR. She will use the loan to buy a decent motorbike and to buy more ingredients for making sweets. She hope this loan will support her demand in running her business on time so as she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike and to buy more ingredients for making sweets.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: A villager from Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Sokheng is 46 years old and married. She makes a living from growing rice and providing makeup and decoration services for weddings in the local area. The current business has returned her about 27,000 KHR per day. Her prior loan was the original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped her to support her farming business on time and she has fully repaid her past loan already. Now, she is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy necessary materials, including makeup, tools and decorative items to support her business. She hopes to earn more income and make her lifestyle stable in a good manner.

loans.use: to buy materials including makeup, tools and decorative items to support her business of providing makeup and decoration services for weddings.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years-old and unmarried. Evangeline works very hard to provide.

Evangeline runs a buy and sell tobacco stand in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional tobacco to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 49 year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Her husband owns a general store in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of products in his store. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase cake, fruit cake, biscuits, bubbles, popcorn, nimko and sell them at the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cake, fruit cake, biscuits, bubbles, popcorn and nimko.

loans.name: Gordove

texts.en:
Gordove, a 50 year-old man with three children lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamis City. For five years, he has earned a living and supported the needs of his  children by providing motor spare parts and accessories for sale. He earns an income of 6,500 PHP a month from this business.

For him, there is nothing that can make him happier than seeing his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Gordove has borrowed 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner GDMPC in order to purchase stock such as spare parts, oil, tires and other accessories to sell.  His plan for the future is to expand his business for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as spare parts, oil, tires and other accessories to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe Group

texts.es: Doña Leticia, la tesorera de este grupo, es clienta de la organización hace 2 años, y ha solicitado 2 préstamos anteriormente. Está luchadora madre trabaja intensamente en el bienestar de sus 3 hijos y en especial por el de su hijo con capacidades especiales. Ellos son el motor de esta incansable empresaria que se dedica a vender cosméticos, perfumes, maquillaje de una marca reconocida y lencería. Esta nueva inyección de capital de trabajo se invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, ya que su cartera de clientes ha aumentado considerablemente así como la demanda y pedidos. Con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, así como cumplir una de sus metas a corto plazo, que era comprarse un automóvil que le facilite la entrega y cobro de los productos. Junto a Leticia continúan en el grupo 8 señoras más, todas muy emprendedoras,  con deseos de salir adelante  y que desarrollan actividades comerciales y de pequeña industria.
texts.en:
Leticia, the treasurer of the group, has been a client of the organization for two years and has taken out two previous loans. She is a tenacious mother who works intensely for the well-being of her 3 children, and especially for her son with special needs. They are the motor that drives this tireless business woman, who sells cosmetics, perfume and makeup from a well-known brand, as well as lingerie. This new injection of business capital will be used to buy more merchandise, since her clientele has increase considerably, and her demand and orders along with it. With the previous loans she was able to improve her family's living conditions and meet one of her short term goals, which was to buy an automobile to facilitate delivery and payment collection. 

Together with Leticia are 8 other ladies in the group, all very dedicated, with wishes to get ahead. They carry out commercial activities and small industries.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lingerie, perfume, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 35 years old and married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been considering how to increase the size of her business, but she doesn't have enough working capital. 

Francisca felt better when she applied for her first loan, and is now applying for her second loan of 1,000 USD. With this loan, she will buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as fruits and vegetables. This will allow her to increase her profits. She is happy with the TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) program that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her kiosk

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Esta casada con Andrés quien se dedica al transporte, y es padre de sus hijos de 17 , 16 , 10 y 06 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Juana es la venta de verduras, instalando  todos los días una mesa al costado de la bodega que tiene su madre en su hogar, de esa manera oferta sus productos a los clientes de la bodega donde no se vende estos productos. Tiene más de 01 año realizando éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo hace sola , le gusta atender a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial , además que le genera buenos ingresos económicos y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que logra vender todos sus productos.Este será el primer préstamo con Kiva , por tanto espera su apoyo financiero para seguir con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles comprará mas verduras tales como lechugas ,tomates , limones , entre otros .
texts.en:
Juana, 35 years old, is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who is also kind and happy. She is married to Andrés, who works in transportation and is the father of their children ages 17, 16, 10, and 6. They live together in their own home. Juana works buy selling vegetables every day at a table beside her mother's home grocery store. This allows her to offer her products to the customers of the store where these products aren't sold. She has been working in this business for over a year and has done so alone thus far. She likes to tend to her customers in a kind and cordial manner. Also, she earns a good income that allows her to have a job and feel productive. She believes her business is going well since she is able to sell all her products. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva. She is requesting this financial aid to continue working toward her goals. With the amount of 500 nuevo soles that she has requested, Juana will buy more vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, lemons, and more.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of products, as the company gives her a greater profit percentage when sales are greater.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 42 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ruby has a business making and selling decorations in the Philippines. She requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase the materials needed to make decorations to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make decorations to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
For the past years, Nancy has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables. She also operates a motorcycle transport business which is her other source of income. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in the business.

With the loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for cooking. She joined Yehu because of its favorable lending policies.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for cooking.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 46-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband owns a mobile shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells mobile accessories and mobile phones in his shop. Presently he is interested in offering a greater variety to his customers. This will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Razia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase mobile accessories and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase mobile accessories to sell.

loans.name: Edit Marleny

texts.es:
Edit es una mujer de 38 años de edad madre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo que sus padres le brindaron; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivada la hortaliza como también el café. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. El esposo es maestro de educación primaria y es el único apoyo que ella tiene para salir adelante. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 100 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie para dar asistencia técnica para evitar daños en sus cosechas.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café y hortalizas y estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Edit, 38, is the mother of three children who depend on her and her husband in all aspects of life. She completed her primary education, which she was able to finish thanks to the effort, dedication and support that her parents offered her. But she was unable to continue due to a lack of economic support. 

She has a lot of experience in agricultural work since her parents taught her from a very young age how to work land where vegetables, as well as coffee, was grown. Her clients are the different buyers that come to the area and also warehouses in the urban area where her products are sold directly.

Her husband is a primary school teacher and is the only support she has to help her succeed. Their crops are located 100 meters from their home, where they go daily on foot to provide technical assistance in order to prevent damage from being done to their harvests.

Today she is requesting help for the purchase of supplies such as fertilizer, compost, foliar fertilizer (fertilizer that is absorbed through leaves), and more for the maintenance of her crops since, with this support, she will be able to protect her coffee and vegetable crops and will be ensured against pests, among other things.

Her dream is to improve her crops day by day and be able to increase the variety and quality of her harvests a little more. 

Her children are her biggest priority, including their studies and other needs that present themselves daily and will lead to the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, foliar fertilizer for her vegetable crops, and coffee

loans.name: Mujeres De Xecojom Momos Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos de estado civil unida de hecho, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando, ella es artesana, elabora canastas, inició este negocio aprendiendo este arte con su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de expereiencia; tambíen cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciente.

Organiza un grupo y decide solitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales para elaboración de caastas y de esa manera poder ampliar su capital e trabajo. En el futuro desea tener capital grande para poder elaborar mas canastas de diferentes diseños y tamaños; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a al comercio.
texts.en:
Santos, 40, is legally single but in a common law marriage. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has five children and of them, two are studying. She is an artisan who makes baskets. She began in this business by learning the art with her mother and now she has ten years of experience. She also has the support of her husband, who is a merchant.

She organized a group and she has decided to request a loan to be used in the purchase of material for the making of baskets. In this way, she can increase her working capital. In the future she hopes to have enough capital to be able to make more baskets with different designs and in different sizes. The other members of the group make their livings in sales.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket making

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 32 años de edad,es divorciada y vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus  hijos de 15, 13, 11  y 05 años de edad respectivamente.La actividad que realiza Mariela  es la venta de comidas como desayunos y almuerzos, contando con un restaurante ubicado en su hogar, donde tiene varias mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes quienes son atendidos de manera amable y cordial, ganándose de esa manera su preferencia. Además los fines de semana venden parrilladas de pollos que son muy requeridos por su buena sazón. Tiene más de 05 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su hija es quien más la ayuda, atendiendo a los clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante que le sirve para pagar los gastos de su hogar, además de poder estar con sus hijos.Este será el primer préstamo con Kiva , por ello espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes.Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas  como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros, buscando conseguir precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Mariela, 32, is divorced and lives in her own house in the company of her children, ages 15, 13, 11 and 5. Mariela makes a living selling food such as breakfast and lunch, with a restaurant located in her home. Here she has several tables and chairs for the comfort of her clients who are attended to in a friendly and cordial manner, which is how she wins their preference. Also, on weekends they sell grilled chicken which is well-liked due to its good seasoning. She has been in this business for over five years, and until now her daughter has helped her the most by attending to the clients.

She likes her business since it generates a constant income and helps her pay for home expenses as well as allowing her to be with her children. This will be her first loan with Kiva, which is why she is hoping for collaboration in order to realize her plans. With the amount requested, 500 nuevos soles, she will buy the necessary ingredients to make her food dishes, such as rice, sugar, oil and more, looking to obtain lower prices for purchasing in large volume.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, oil and more

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Elma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell for her fruits vending business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está unión libre, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes,  y almácigo de buena calidad y fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de siembra para el café, y de tener todo listo a inicio de lluvias  para hacer el trabajo de siembre y esto con el objetivo de aumentar y mejorar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras condiciones que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Walter, 34, is in a common law marriage, and lives with his children and wife who are his first priority. With his loan he will buy fertilizer, high-quality coffee seedlings, and fungicides as well as pay for coffee sowing labor. He will have everything ready in order to do the sowing work when the rains begin with the objective of raising and improving the density of plants per area, as well as taking advantage of the good fertility of the land, the climate conditions and other conditions favorable to coffee cultivation.

With these improvements to the cultivation process he hopes to obtain a bit of revenue and improve the life conditions of his family as well as investing a bit more in the cultivating area and meeting some other goals. This is the first loan he will have received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow coffee

loans.name: Nuevos Orizontes De Jutacaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Nicolasa es de estado civil casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos que no estan estudiando, ella se dedica a crianza de animales domesticos en este caso compra cerditos para criarlos y despues venderlos, inició este negocio por herencia de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de dichos a experiencia; ella cuenta con el gran apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar 4 cerditos y concentrado para ellos, en el futuro desea tener una granja grande con otros animales dómesticos, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican también a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa is married (common-law) and is 48 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school, but has 6 children who are in school.  She works raising farm animals.  In this case, she buys baby pigs to raise and then sell.  She started this business after inheriting it from her parents and has been doing it for 15 years.  She has great support from her husband, who is also an entrepreneur.

This group is organized to ask for a loan to be used to buy 4 piglets and concentrated feed for them.  In the future she hopes to have a large farm with other domestic animals.  The other members of the group also work raising animals.

loans.use: buy piglets.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Nem is a 31-year-old mother of two children. 

Rice farming has been the only source of her family’s income for eight years. The current business earns her about 11,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Nem’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is in her second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Nem will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman who has three children. She is 47 years old and resides in Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City. She owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Rosalinda has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for the weeding maintenance labor costs on the farm. In 2012, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for weeding maintenance labor costs on her farm

loans.name: Elí

texts.es: Elí, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hijo los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer una buena preparación del terreno, la compra de fertilizantes, semilla de frijol y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así obtener una buena geminación, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elí is 28 years old, married, and lives with his wife and son (who are his top priority).  With his loan he wants to prepare his land well, buy fertilizer, bean seeds, and other products to apply to his crop and in this way obtain good growth.  In addition, he will pay for laborer(s) to apply these products and help with the planting once the land is developed.  By so doing, he can rest assured that he has done a good job.

He hopes to take advantage of the good climate and land where he is and also make use of his several years'-worth of experience growing basic crops.  In addition, he wants to be able to buy the best, highest-quality products so that his farm develops in a good and healthy manner.  He also hopes to obtain a good harvest and produce crops quickly.

With the profits that he makes he plans to support his family's education and wellbeing and also meet some family goals.  He also wants to continue investing in his farm.  This is the first loan that he is receiving from FUDECOSUR.  Before, he didn't receive any communal bank loans, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: grow beans.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district, Vy is a local farmer who grows rice on one and a half hectares of land as a main source of income. She has three children, two of whom are still in school. The current business, which she has been with for ten years, has earned her about 14,200 KHR per day to support her family's needs. 

Vy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past four cycles. With the past loans, which she has repaid successfully, she feels confident that she can improve her living conditions and provide decent food for her kids. Now, she has formed a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the group's leader, she will use the loan portion to grow her rice. She hopes to increase the income with her business so she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to grow her rice

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Aged 46 years old, Ky is a rural villager from the Ek Phnom district who earns a living by farming rice and planting soybeans as her family's main source of income. She has been in this business for 14 years. She also works for others for a fee to complement the family’s income. She has seven children, four of whom are still dependent and in school.

Ky has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, Ky wants to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 62 años, es un hombre amable y soñador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 8 años de edad.El trabajo de Alberto consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como  arroz, azúcar, harina, leche, huevos, entre otros. Realiza esta actividad  económica en un local que tiene en su vivienda. Lleva 04 años en este trabajo y sus clientes han aumentado favorablemente. Se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de  mantener a su familia y también porque no  puede hacer trabajos forzados ya que tuvo un accidente en su empleo anterior.Comenta que su negocio es rentable porque tiene buenos ingresos económicos. además está ubicado en un lugar accesible para todos.Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio para salir a adelante e incrementar sus ventas.Por tanto éste será su prestamo número 05 con Kiva y espera seguir  siendo un socio  puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles,comprará mas productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, huevos, conservas de pescado y otros porductos ,ya que si su negocio cuenta con productos variables tendrá mayor cantidad de clientes e incrementara sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alberto, 62, is a friendly man and a dreamer. He lives in his own house with his wife and 8-year-old child. Alberto makes a living selling groceries such as rice, sugar, flour, milk, eggs, and more. He sells these groceries from a room of his home. He has been doing this work for four years and his client base has increased favorably. 

He began doing this work due to the need to support his family and also because he cannot do hard labor because he had an accident at his prior job. He indicates that his business is profitable because it makes good revenue, and is located in a place accessible to all.

He hopes to continue maintaining his business in order to get ahead and increase his sales. This will be his fifth loan with Kiva and he hopes to continue being a punctual member. With the amount requested - 1000 soles - he will buy more grocery products such as rice, sugar, eggs, canned fish, and more, since if his business offers variable products he will have a larger quantity of customers and he will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, eggs, canned fish, and more

loans.name: Jimmy Alonso

texts.es: Jimmy, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer  una adecuada preparación del terreno, la compra de fertilizantes, semilla de frijol y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jimmy is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings.  They are his top priority.  He will use the money from this loan to prepare his land and buy fertilizers, bean seeds, and other things for his crops so that they will have good germination, good quality seeds, and pay for labor with which to apply the products and help with the crops once they are developed.  This way he will ensure good work.  He wants to take advantage of the good climate and soil in the zone.  He also wants to use the experience he has from having managed basic grains over various years.  Besides being able to buy the best quality products, he wants his plantation to have good development and health so that he will have a good short term harvest.  He will use the proceeds from his harvest toward his family's wellbeing and also to meet some family goals and continue to invest in his crops.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with ease and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy farming supples

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Jacquiline works very hard to provide for them.

Jacquiline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, bread, soap and groceries to sell. 

Jacquiline has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Jacquiline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, bread, soap and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A married mother and aged 56, Channy is a local farmer residing in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. To support her daily living costs, she grows cassava on two hectares of land. She earns from her current business, which she has been involved in for five years, about 41,100 KHR per day. 

Channy has never been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before so this is the first loan for her, but it is the seventh cycle for her group member. Now, she is seeking a 500,000 KHR loan; it is the same amount for her group member. As the leader, Channy will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make a better income to have a new business to provide comfortable living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Tha is 47 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in the farming business for ten years. Sometimes, they work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Tha has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her family, to have sufficient food and to provide for her children’s education. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Tha is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner so as to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Bovel district, Phorn is a 42-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school.
