The main sources of her family’s income come from rice farming and cassava planting, which she has been doing for several years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 20,600 per day to spend on daily expenses.

This is the first loan for Phorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her cultivated land. She will also use a portion of it to spend on labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her cultivated land

loans.name: Deiner

texts.es: Deiner, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende contratar maquinaria para que le realice una buena preparación del terreno, además de hacer la compra de fertilizantes, semilla de frijol que se adapte bien a la zona y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una geminación uniforme y adecuada, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar de alistar todo antes de        inicio de las lluvias y las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el estudio de sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Deiner is 28 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children (who are his top priority). With his loan he wants to buy machinery in order to prepare his land well.  In addition, he wants to fertilizer, bean seeds (which do well where he lives), and other products to apply to his crop and in this way obtain good, uniform growth. In addition, he will pay for laborer(s) to apply these products and help with the planting once the land is developed. By so doing, he can rest assured that he has done a good job.

He hopes to be ready to take advantage of the good rains, good climate, and good land where he lives and also make use of his several years'-worth of experience growing basic crops. In addition, he wants to be able to buy the best, highest-quality products so that his farm develops in a good and healthy manner. He also hopes to obtain a good harvest and produce crops quickly.

With the profits that he makes he plans to support his family's education and wellbeing and also meet some family goals. He also wants to continue investing in his farm. This is the first loan that he is receiving from FUDECOSUR. Before, he didn't receive any communal bank loans, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: grow beans.

loans.name: Twanzane-Solidaire Group

texts.fr: La cliente Saasita est représentante du collectif de crédit  Twanzane-Solidaire. Entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Son conjoint est un agent dans une entreprise privée. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle commença cette affaire a l’âge de 18 ans avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 fûts d’huile de palme. Les taxes et tracasseries administratives constituent un défi pour le développement de son entreprise. Dans le futur, elle souhaite construire sa maison en matériaux durables. Au finish, elle félicite Hekima pour son soutien aux petits commerçants.
texts.en:
Saasita, the representative of the group Twanzane-Solidaire, is a dynamic entrepreneur, aged 44, and a mother of eight children. Her husband works in a private company.

Saasita sells palm oil. This new loan will allow her to buy 20 containers of palm oil. Taxes and administrative red tape are challenges to the development of her business. 

In the future, she would like to build her house with durable materials. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of small-scale merchants.

loans.use: to buy 20 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Komlan est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Marié à une revendeuse, il est aussi père de famille. Menuisier de profession, il travaille le bois depuis 2005 dans son atelier. Komlan sollicite un cinquiéme prêt chez WAGES afin d’acheter des planches pour la fabrication de fauteuils et d’armoires. Il souhaite réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans la création d’une autre entreprise. A terme, il aimerait devenir un grand professionnel dans le domaine du bois et créer une école de formation en menuiserie.
texts.en: Komlan is a 36-year-old man. He is a father and married to a retailer. A carpenter by trade, he has worked with wood since 2005 in his workshop. Komlan is requesting his fifth loan from WAGES with the goal of buying planks of wood for making chairs and armoires. He hopes to reinvest his extra profit in the launch of a new business. He would like to be a great professional in the field of woodworking and to establish a carpentry school.

loans.use: To purchase planks for the construction of furniture and cupboards.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio and his family live in the mountainous area of Isabela. His main source of income is rice farming, and he has been doing that for almost six years now. According to Rogelio, his yield in this activity is of great help because some of the yield serves as the daily food intake of his family, while he sells some to support their other expenditures. At present, Rogelio needs additional capital for his farming activities. Thus, he is requesting a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP. He said that he will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 53-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges, melons, and watermelons in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of expenses, he finds it difficult.

Therefore, his wife, Parveen, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit amounts, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Previously, Ade has been running several small businesses including a motorcycle wash and an electronic credit business. He also owns a small corn field. Ade lives in Bogor, a rural area about two hours from Jakarta.  Ade is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

To increase the family's income, 18 months ago Ade joined Ruma because he wanted to start expanding to other business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credit.  He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and providing a bill payment service. For the last three months, he has around $55 /day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To use as working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. He earns an income by providing transportation services. He has done this for 5 years to support the needs of his 2 children. He gets an income of 5,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 42-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier when he sees his children succeed in their studies. Without hesitation, Edwin requests an amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair his transport vehicle. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business and provide his children with a better education.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Marko, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  He has been a carpenter since 2003.  He works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Marko's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more wood, wood fix, sponge for sofa sets, materials for covering furniture, and managed to make more furniture. He has paid all his loans successfully. He used his profits to buy a TV set and a refrigerator, and started building his house.  He will use this loan to buy more wood, wood fix, sponge and materials. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

Marko will share this loan with his loan group "KINOLE" with 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more wood, wood fix, sponge and materials.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie, 52 years old, is from Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. For the past 15 years, Vergie has cultivated her farm, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale and earning 2,000 PHP monthly. In 2012, she joined GDMPC microcredit and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase seedlings and manure fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and manure fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, a 25-year-old woman, is married and has two children. She lives in Tabid, Ozamiz City. To make a living, she manages a business planting and harvesting seaweed for sale. She has been doing this for two years, earning 3,000 PHP a month from this activity. As a new member of GDMPC micro credit, she is requesting a loan of 4,600 PHP to purchase seedlings, roofing and other materials needed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, roofing and other materials needed for her seaweed harvesting business.

loans.name: Juan Agustín

texts.es:
Juan tiene 71 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él vive con su familia que esta conformada por su esposa y 2 hijos en la cual colaboran en la siembra del maíz es una familia muy unida, es una persona muy conocida en la zona, muy amable y respetuoso con las personas que viven alredor, es muy trabajador. Ademas, se dedica la comercio de animales compra y vende eso lo aprendió desde pequeño que su padre le enseño el oficio y hasta el día de hoy sigue trabajando en eso. 
 
 Compra los insumos en el pueblo mas cercano que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su casa . Para poder comprar los insumos y alimentos para su casa, a demás de eso el sale a otro caserío cercano, compra los animales que le servirán para la venta, el traslado de los insumos y de los animales es muy difícil ya que les toca caminar 8 kilometros. son de ida y de venida  para poder llegar a su destino.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para iniciar a sembrar maíz  y para el mantenimiento de los animales y poder venderlos, ya que se acerca la época de siembra el tiene disponible 35 metros cuadrados de terreno para trabajar en ellas.

   La necesidad que el señor tiene y que sera cubierto por el crédito que solicito sera de mucha ayuda por que no le alcanza el dinero para poder comenzar la siembra ya que se acerca la época. espera que en su comienzo de la siembra del maíz le valla bien y a la vez que en la siembra obtenga en su cosecha una buena cantidad de maíz y con eso poder tener un mayor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 71, is married and has two children. He lives with his family which is made up of his wife and two children who collaborate in the sowing of the corn. They are a very united family. He is a very well-known person in the area, very friendly and respectful with the people who live around him. He is very hard-working. He also makes a living buying and selling animals, which he learned to do when he was young and his father taught him the work, and which he has continued to do up until today.

He buys his supplies in the nearest town, which is four kilometers from his house. In order to be able to buy supplies and food for his household, he also goes to a farmhouse nearby and buys animals that he will be able to sell. The transfer of supplies and animals is very difficult since it requires them to walk 8 kilometers. They must travel both-ways to be able to arrive at their destination.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo will help him to buy agricultural supplies to begin to sow corn, since the sowing season is coming up and he has 35 square meters of land to work with, and to maintain his animals in order to sell them.

The loan he is requesting will be very helpful to cover his needs because he does not have enough money to begin the harvest and the sowing period is approaching. He hopes that the beginning of the corn harvest goes well for him, and also that the harvest provides them with a good quantity of corn and with that he will be able to have a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to begin to sow corn, since the sowing season is coming up and he has 35 square meters of land to work with, and for the maintenance of his animals in order to sell them

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lenie is 40 years old.

Lenie has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her shop.

Lenie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her shop.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

She wants to start a vegetable and fruit vending business. Her major goal is to have a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman, 34, is married with five children residing in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province. Two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice, and growing soybeans and sesame for 16 years. She can earn about KHR 27,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.

Saman has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the loans from VisionFund and successfully used the loans to better support her family. She is now applying for another loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield to increase her family’s income and make a living better.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny works hard to support her family. She is 37 years old and has a general store in the Philippines. Leny requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items for resale, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs and spices.

Leny has been in this business for five years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Leny would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items for resale, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 49 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Isabel is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock and vitamins for her business.

Isabel has been in this business for 17 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Agrifina to improve her business. She has a kiosk, where many people come to buy items every day. She will buy some additional groceries for resale, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, as well as a refrigerator to keep drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Agrifina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for resale, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, as well as a refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Han is a 53-year-old married mother of eight children. Corn planting has been the main source of her family’s income for 30 years, and to better support the family and help earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Han’s group consists of four members who have been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles and completely repaid the loans. The past loans have helped Han better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. Han, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and corn seeds for her farmland and also use a portion of the loan to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her corn fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Reap's Group

texts.en:
Reap is 40 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has three dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. Cassava farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for ten years. Besides this agribusiness, she also sells grocery items, while her husband is a carpenter. With these current businesses, she can earn approximately 50,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the first microloan for Reap’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. They both have been with VisionFund for six loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now Reap is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use another portion to spend on labor costs. She hopes to increase her current business so as to increase her income in order to earn a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en: Palmira is 26 years old and married. She has two children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is now applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, milk, fish and slippers. She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, milk, fish and slippers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells "nipa" -- woven palm mats used for housing and construction -- in the Philippines. She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to resell in her business.

Maribel has been in this business for six years. Maribel earns more income from buying and selling fish and crabs.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa (woven palm mats) for resale.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman with five children who attend school. Her husband is a farmer and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mesaidi has operated a kiosk business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are people from her village. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en:
Fareed is 39 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is the mother of four children. She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidery cloths are liked by everyone. Presently her stock of embroidery material is almost gone. Therefore, she is interested in purchasing a variety of embroidery materials, including colorful threads, beads, stones, needle and cloth. For that purpose, Fareed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business. 

With the profits, Fareed wants to build her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profits so that she can easily pay back the loan amount as well as build her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan amount because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery material.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 36-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and three children. Her husband is a janitor by trade and he has a very low monthly income, causing them to face a lot of financial problems.

Parveen is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for ten years. Her clients are very happy and well satisfied with her work. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines so that her production would be increased. She would also purchase some thread and cloth for the business. She would pay her installments with the profit amount and pay some household expenses as well. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines for stitching dresses, as well as thread and cloth.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Sarat is a 52-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice, cassava, and soybean farming, which has been done for ten years. They supplement this income by working for others for a fee. With her current business, Sarat and her husband can earn about $18 per day and manage to save about $3 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the second loan for Sarat with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loan. Now she is applying for another loan to buy a battery charger machine for supporting her new business. Sarat plans to run a new business that charges batteries in her village. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a battery charger machine for supporting her new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Metelin

texts.en:
Metelin is 39 years old and married with five children.

Metelin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sugar, soap, rice, milk, canned goods, etc., for resale.

Metelin has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from mobile prepaid load and pig fattening businesses.

Metelin aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sugar, soap, rice, milk and canned goods for resale.

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Doña juana de 31  años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos y su esposo. Ella  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios  años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Ella es una mujer  trabajadora, responsable y muy conocida en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Doña  juana ha decidido solicitar un crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que ella consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Doña Juana is 31 years old and lives in her own home together with her four children and her husband. She works as a farmer, growing corn and beans. She has been working this job for many years and this is how she earns her daily bread. She is a hardworking, responsible woman who is well known by the people in her community for her generosity and kindness. Juana has decided to apply for a loan in order to purchase seed, fertilizers, insecticides, and other items. What she wants most is that her harvest is abundant and better than in years past, as this is the way in which she provides for her family. She trusts that with God's help, her dedication and her resolve to work she will achieve her dream of improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Phnom Prek district of Battambang province, Sokun is 37 years old and married. To make a living, he has been planting corn for almost seven years. The current business earns him about 50,000 KHR per day but he can manage to save about 20,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses.

Sokun received his first loan one cycle ago and he completely paid back the loan. The past loan from VisionFund has helped his family significantly improve their living and allow them to buy a plot of farmland. He is now asking for another loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Melinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. él participo en el conflicto armado que hubo en los años 1978 en la cual el quedo lisiado. Hoy en día trabajar de sastre desde hace 15 años de ahí mantiene a su esposa y los dos hijos que tiene  uno de ellos 13 años de edad y le ayuda a la sastrería y el otro niño tiene 6 años, su esposa se dedica  a los oficio domestico. Aprendió el oficio cuando se cambio de domicilio y le ayudaba a una señora sastre y luego de independizo. 

Compra la tela para trabajar en los uniformes del instituto de la ciudad y algún otro trabajo que lleguen a solicitar en una ciudad que esta a 20 kilómetros de donde vive y en ocasiones tiene que ir a comprarlos a una ciudad que esta más lejos.  

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagarle a su hermano por haberle instalado  la luz eléctrica en su casa y para comprar materiales para la sastrería.

Él planea continuar trabajando con la fundación campo; ya que tiene pensado construir su casa de paredes de ladrillo; ya que en este momento esta construida de lamina, y con un techo en donde puedan refugiarse del mal clima.
texts.en:
Oscar, 50, is married and has 2 children.  He participated in the 1978 armed conflict, in which he became disabled.  Now he has worked as a tailor for 15 years, supporting his wife and their 2 children.  One of their children is 13 and helps him in the tailoring shop, and the other child is 6 years old.  His wife works as a domestic.  Oscar learned this trade when he moved from home and was helping a dressmaker.  Later he started to work independently.

Oscar buys fabric in a city that is 20 kilometers from where he lives, so that he can work on school uniforms for an institute in the city and also do other work that people request.  At times, he has to go to a city that is much further away to buy the fabric.

Oscar is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo to pay his brother for having electricity installed in his house, and also to buy supplies for his tailoring shop.

Oscar plans to continue to work with the Fundacion Campo, as he is planning on building brick walls for his house, because his house is currently built with corrugated metal and he also wants to have a roof where his family can have protection from bad weather.

loans.use: to pay his brother for having electricity installed in his home, and to buy tailoring supplies

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house selling second-hand clothing. She is making a good income from selling second hand and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her second hand clothing business a year ago with her working capital of $ 600.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts and shorts

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a hotel in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells delicious dishes in his hotel. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of expenses, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of food products like rice, pulses, chicken, beef and vegetables. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products like rice, pulses, chicken, beef and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Dy

texts.en:
Maria Dy is from Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. 

To earn a living, Maria Dy owns and operates a bicycle transport service. (A bicycle is a bike with a passenger cab.) Maria Dy has been in this business for twenty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities. 

Maria Dy is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP, which would be used to purchase another tricycle unit. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services, which in turn helped her improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase another tricycle unit

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a widow with eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She explains that her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a coconut selling business. She sells her coconuts at wholesale prices to local neighbors. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 KES to purchase additional sacks of coconuts for resale purposes. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Reay's Group

texts.en:
Reay, 40, lives in a rural village in the Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district. She is a married mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Her family’s income is from planting cassava on her four-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for 10 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 73,000 per day.

Reay is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, Reay hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business to earn more income to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dried coconut meat.

Gerlie has been in this business for six years. Gerlie earns more income from her general store and farming rice.

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Bunroet's Group

texts.en:
Bunroet, a rural villager from the Sampov Meas district, is a 64-year-old widow. She has two children.

To earn a living, she has been running an internet service in her village. Having been in this business for almost two years, she currently earns approximately 86,000 KHR per day but she typically manages to save approximately 46,000 KHR of that amount each day after daily living expenses are taken into account.

Bunoert has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and fully repaid the past loan. The first loan helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more computers to support her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to provide a better service to customers so as to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional computers

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Mr. Batsuuri is a 40-year-old man living with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His son studies at university and will graduate this summer.

Since 2010, he has been providing plumbing services to individuals and entities on temporary employment contracts.

His family's house has deteriorated over the years and needs repairs, including a new floor, windows, and wall insulation. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his house. He believes that the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and to emit less smoke, which would contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building materials (windows, flooring, fiberglass) to repair and renovate his family's house

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés de 34 años de edad, anhela crear su propio negocio con el fin de mejorar la condición económica e su familia, motivo que lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito para capacitarse en panadería y comenzar a materializar su proyecto de negocio. 
Sus habilidades para la cocina, le han permitido dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de postres en su localidad, por lo cual espera ampliar sus conocimientos y ampliar su portafolio de productos.
texts.en:
Andres is 34 years old. He wants very much to start his own business with the goal of improving his family's economic situation. This has motivated him to request a loan to get training in bread making and start making his business a reality.

His ability for cooking has made it possible for him to work making and selling desserts in his town, so he hopes to expand his skills and his portfolio of products.

loans.use: pay for training in bread making.

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with his family members in a rural village in the Phnom Proek district, Rithy is 29 years old and married with two children. They are still in school. He and his wife earn a living through planting corn and cassava. Having been in this business for six years, he manages to earn about 19,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Rithy’s group consists of three members and they are just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields and earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ambulant vending banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Nelinda has been in this business for 20 years and earns more income from her boarding house rental business.

Nelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to puchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Ru El

texts.en: Ruel is 39 years old and married with five children. He lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, he owns and manages a farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has belonged to GDMPC for years and now he's requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, he plans to improve his farming methods in order to improve his income from the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for training in basic cooking

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 40 years old and married with five children.

Purita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Purita has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from her buy and sell of rice business.

Purita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de preparación del terreno, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer siembra a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar el área de plantas, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras condiciones que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 44, is married and lives with his children and his wife, who are his biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and fungicide, and pay labor to prepare the land.  He also plans to buy some seedling plants to grow at the beginning of the rainy season to increase his planting area and make the most of good soil fertility, the climate, and other conditions that favor coffee growing. 

With these improvements to the crop he hopes to earn some profit and improve his family's living conditions.  He also hopes to invest a little more in the crop and achieve some goals.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Shena

texts.en:
Shena is a 34-year-old mother of one. She lives in Lusaka province, Zambia, with her husband. She runs her own business, which is a Micro-Distribution Centre (MDC), where she sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers and customers. She has been running her business for close to four years now.

Shena says she loves her business because it is a way for her to provide for her family rather than solely depending on her husband. When asked how her community benefits from her business, Shena is quick to say that her business provides to other small business owners in her community, a place where they can order soft drinks without having to spend any money on transportation to go into the town centre.

Today, Shena is taking out a Kiva loan so that she can increase her line of products. Currently, she only stocks Coca-Cola and Fanta in glass bottles, on a very small scale. This loan will help her to add Sprite to her product line.

Shena has high hopes for the future. She dreams of one day being able to distribute a variety of Coca-Cola products, on a very large scale.

loans.use: To add Sprite to her line of products

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Nelia. She is a mother to a 4-year-old girl and is expecting her second child. Nelia runs her own business at one of Lusaka’s busiest markets. Nelia’s business is the sale of Coca-Cola products, such as Fanta and Sprite soft drinks. She sells the products at wholesale to other small businesses within the market. Every day Nelia spends her time serving customers and running up and down, to ensure that she has enough empty crates to order more drinks from the suppliers. She has employed one person to help her at her shop.

Nelia started running this shop straight out of high school because her father was already in the business. Currently, business is good and she says the one thing holding her back is that she does not have enough working capital. As a result, she cannot order enough stock to satisfy the demand from her customers. She is taking out a Kiva loan because the loan will enable her to order more stock for her shop.

Nelia dreams of opening up more outlets, so that she can provide the best education for her daughter, and her unborn child.

loans.use: To order more stock for her shop

loans.name: Métohoué Vincent

texts.fr: Métohoué Vincent âgé de 33 ans, est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Célestine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Métohoué Vincent vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Métohoué Vincent a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais est forgeron de formation. Métohoué Vincent fabrique des marmites à base d’aluminium depuis sept ans. En plus de cette activité, Métohoué Vincent vend aussi des céréales, ce qui lui permet subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Métohoué Vincent sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit précédemment obtenu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Métohoué Vincent is 33 years old and is married to a retailer named Célestine. The couple has four dependent children, all of whom go to school. Métohoué Vincent lives with his wife and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. 

Métohoué Vincent had very little schooling, but is a blacksmith by training. Métohoué Vincent has been making aluminum cooking pots for seven years. In addition, Métohoué Vincent also sells grains, which allows him to meet the needs of his family. 

In order to satisfy his clientele, Métohoué Vincent is asking ALIDé for financial support for the second time. The previous loan was reimbursed in full.

loans.use: to buy aluminum.

loans.name: Carmen Yaneth

texts.es:
Carmen de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en la ciudad de Puerto Cortes.
Carmen inicio su negocio hace 3 años donde obtiene los ingresos necesarios para su familia, es un pequeño negocio donde elabora y vende jugos naturales, agua en bolsa helada, churros y dulces. Este negocio de venta lo tiene enfrente de una terminal de buses donde hay afluencia de personas que viajan de un lugar a otro, lo que le permite incrementar las ventas. Esta solicitando otro préstamo  por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar productos como frutas, azúcar, agua, churros, dulces y otros insumos para su negocio. Ella esta creciendo con su negocio y tiene como meta hacer grande su negocio mediante esta oportunidad de inversión y seguir obteniendo buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 37 years old, a single mother, and has two children with whom she lives in the city of Puerto Cortes. Carmen started her business three years ago, from which she gets the income necessary for her family. It is a small business where she makes and sells natural juices, cold water in a bag, as well as chips and candy. 

Her stall is in front of the bus terminal, where there are many passersby traveling from one place to another, which allows her to increase sales. 

She is requesting another loan for 5,000 lempiras, so that she can buy products such as fruit, sugar, water, chips, candy and other supplies for her business. She is seeing her business grow, and her goal is to make her business bigger through this investment opportunity and to continue getting good income.

loans.use: To buy fruit, sugar, water, chips, candy and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is 33 years old, married and the father of four children. He adores his family and works closely with his wife to pay all their many expenses so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Abdul started his own business providing electronic goods five years ago. He has a fair number of customers. He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to increase his supply of electronic goods so that he can respond quickly to customer's needs. With the help of this loan, he will purchase ceiling fans, TVs, and washing machines to sell at a profitable price. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns.

loans.use: To purchase ceiling fans, TVs, and washing machines to sell

loans.name: Besnart

texts.en:
Besnart works very hard to support her family. She lives in Lusaka's Chawama compound with her father, her five children and five dependents. She runs a container, which deals in selling of Coca-Cola products in her community. She runs the business with her father.
Besnart says she loves running the business because it is a good way for her to provide for her family. She is taking out a Kiva loan so that she can purchase 238 crates of soft drinks to increase her stock levels.
Besnart is hopeful that the loan will help her grow her business, as it has been stagnant for a long time. Besnart says her business has not grown very much from the time she started because she has never had the money to inject into the business. She is grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva.
Besnart would like to open another outlet one day.

loans.use: to order more crates of soft drinks so that she can increase her stock.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: Fernanda is a 61-year-old widow with two children living in Labuyo, Tangub City. To support her children, she plants and harvests bananas on her own farm, earning an income of 5,000 PHP monthly. In 2010, she joined GDMPC micro credit to gain access to micro finance. She then borrowed 8,000 PHP to pay for the weeding maintenance labor cost for her farm to be improved. In the future, she plans to cultivate a vacant area to double her income and possibly prepare better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To pay for weeding maintenance labor costs

loans.name: Isdora

texts.en:
Isdora, a 57-year-old lady from Homabay county, is married to Domnic, a farmer who also contributes to the support of the family. They have four children ages 18, 16, 14 and 11 years old. For the last two years Isdora has been operating a poultry farm where she rears small chicks for sale, earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

Isdora is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD to purchase a locally made poultry breeder for her poultry breeding. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. Her dreams are to become a successful poultry farmer and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase another locally made poultry breeder.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Yeabu from the eastern area of Waterloo in Freetown. She is married with three children. She did not going to school, so she decided to do run a restaurant so she can take care of her family,  

Along with the restaurant, she sells palm oil and coconut oil.  She has been running this business for 15 years and she works at the business 7 days per week, 12 hours per day.  Yeabu says that her business is doing well; she has taken a loan for a third time, and out of the profit she is able to take care of her children.

Yeabu has requested a loan to purchase bags of rice, gallons of palm oil, pure water, and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and start her building project. 

In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, gallons of palm oil, pure water, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. He has six children and has been doing this work for 43 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and a salary job.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "The returns and the freedom," which enables him to engage in other activities. His biggest challenge is unfavorable weather conditions. He hasn't named the animals on his farm.

James was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because of the favorable terms." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Microfinance can help small-scale farmers to grow."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, James replied that he will be able to pay school fees for the last child who is in university.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. James owns the following: cow, poultry, pump and bicycle, but does not own pigs, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, a TV or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ligia Gerardina

texts.es: Ligia Gerardina, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hijo el cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, semilla de frijol con un alto porcentaje de germinación y se adapte bien a la zona y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ligia Geradina is 23 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son, who is her top priority.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer, bean seed with high germination and adaptation to the zone, and other items for the planting.  She will also pay for labor to apply the products and help with the plants once they are developed.  In this way she can ensure good work.

She wants to take advantage of the good climate and soil it the zone for this crop and also to use the experience she has from several years of managing basic grains.  Besides being able to buy the best products, of best quality so that her crops will develop well and be healthy, she will have an abundant harvest in a short time.  She hopes to be able to improve her family's wellbeing and education, complete some family goals, and continue to invest in more crops.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with easier terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to re-sell.

loans.name: Thelma Rubídia

texts.es:
Thelma tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeña se dedica al comercio junto con sus hermanas. Cuando era una niña perdió a sus padres y desde entonces las hermanas la criaron. Ella se caso y tubo a tres hijos dos señoritas y un varón de diferente edades el barón tiene 10 años y las señorita tiene 15 años y la mayor 20 años. La señora se dedica al comercio y su esposo trabajaba con los camiones propios; pero un día  lo  asaltaron y lo golpearon en la cabeza y de ese golpe murió, dejando a los hijos y su esposa. Desde entonces ella se a dedicado a trabajar día a día junto con sus hermanas, a la venta de ropa de pueblo en pueblo ya que a ella le enseñaron el arte del comercio y a si a podido sacar a delante a los hijos en el estudio.  

Para comprar la ropa,  ella se desplaza a dos luagres y  paga para transportarse hasta el lugar donde compra la ropa que son aproximadamente 29 kilómetros; compra variedades de ropa como camisas y pantalones para niño, ropa para adulto, entre hombre y mujer y ropa de interior.  

El prestamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  surtir mas ropa para la época del día de las madres; ya que ella tiene ropa almacenada pero quiere invertir en comprar mas para tener mas en este mes y poder complacer a los clientes.

     La necesidad que sera satisfecha con el prestamos es poder crecer en el comercio de la venta de ropa para poder tener una estabilidad económica para que los hijos puede llegar a triunfar en la universidad y a demás poder vivir mejor.

      La señora considera que con el préstamo que solicita mejorara la estabilidad económica ya que ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y también a la venta de flores para difuntos.
	A demás ella menciona que teniendo mayor entrada de dinero tendrá mayor oportunidad de que sus hijos podrán seguir estudiando

planea seguir trabajando con la institución; debido a que  es su primer crédito que tiene y menciona que en el futuro piensa comprar una casa en la zona donde vive y ese sueño lo podrá lograr con un crédito solicitándolo en fundación campo
texts.en:
Thelma, 47, is a widow and has three children.  She has worked in retail with her sisters since she was very young.  When she was a child she lost her parents, so her sisters raised her.  She got married and had three children: two girls, ages 15 and 20, and a boy, 10.

She makes a living in retail and her husband worked with his own trucks.  One day, though, he was assaulted and hit in the head, and he died from his injuries, leaving his wife and children.  Since then she has worked every day with her sisters selling clothing from town to town.  They taught her the art of retail and this is how she has gotten her children ahead in their studies.

To buy the clothing she goes to two places to make her purchases and pays for transportation, approximately 29 kilometers.  She buys a variety of clothing such as shirts and pants for children, clothing for adults, and underwear.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to stock more clothing for the Mother's Day season.  She has clothing stored but she wants to invest this month and have more so she's able to satisfy her customers.

The loan will satisfy her need to grow in her business selling clothing.  This way she'll be able to have economic stability and her children can be successful in the university as well as be able to live better.

She thinks the loan she'll request will improve her economic stability, because she makes a living selling clothing as well as funeral flowers.  She also says that with more money her children will have a better opportunity to be able to continue studying.

She plans to continue working with the institution because it's her first loan.  She says that in the future she hopes to buy a house in her neighborhood.  She'll be able to realize that dream with a loan from Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for the Mother's Day season

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos.  su familia que esta conformada por 4 miembros, su esposa y hijos la esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y los hijos mayores se dedican trabajar, ellos trabajan con su padre en la siembra y algunas veces en la construcción y remodelación de casas. Ademas, de eso se dedica a la agricultura; posee algunas vacas y también siembra maíz. Es una persona de buenos principios, es responsable, amable con los vecinos y es miembro de la iglesia de la zona.  los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en el pueblo mas cercano donde compra la mayoría de las cosas que ocupa para su trabajo, también compra en una ciudad algunas cosas que no puede encontrar en el pueblo a una distancia de 20 kilómetros. Para trasladarse de  su casa hasta la ciudad tiene la dificultad de transportarse  ya que tiene que gastar en el transporte y si hay por que es muy escaso y si no encuentra tiene que caminar esa distancia al pueblo.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultivara maíz y el maicillo y para la compra del abono para la planta del maíz y los insecticidas para el control de las plagas. Considera que el préstamo que solicita le ayudara a obtener mayor ingreso en la cosecha que realice en la temporada, también comprar vacas para obtener una cantidad de leche que ocupa para el consumo diario en su casa y así el préstamo le mejorara la condición de vida  a él y a su familia. Piensa en instalar una tienda de productos basicos en su casa para obtener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 64, married, and has three children. His family is comprised of four members, including his wife and children. His wife looks after the home and the older children work. They work with their father farming, and sometimes in constructing and renovating houses. In addition to that, he farms, has several cows, and also grows corn.

He is a person of good character, responsible, friendly with the neighbors, and is a member of the area's church. He buys agricultural supplies in the nearest village, where he buys the majority of things that he uses for his work.

He also buys some things in the city, 20 km away,  that he can't find in the village. To travel from his home to the city, he has the challenge of transportation, as he has to spend money for transportation if it exists, as it is very scarce. If he doesn't find it he has to walk that distance to the village. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay for the rent on the land where he will grow corn and sorghum, and to purchase the manure for his corn crop, and insecticides for pest control. He considers that the loan he is applying for will help him get better income at harvest time.  It will also help him buy cows so that he can obtain a quantity of milk for daily use in his home, and this way the loan will improve the quality of life for him and for his family. 

He plans to set up a store in his home with basic household products, as another source of income.

loans.use: To pay the rent on the land where he will grow corn and sorghum and to buy fertilizer for his corn, and insecticides for pest control.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar, es madre soltera y vive en compañía de su hijo de 08 años de edad en su casa propia.Jessica se dedica a vender productos comestibles por eso cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en su hogar, desde alli atiende a sus clientes, que en la mayoría son sus propios vecinos.Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar y atender a su hijo sin problemas.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche , conservas de pescado , entre otros .
texts.en: Jessica is 29 years old and is a very hardworking and enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is a single mother and lives with her eight year old son in a home of her own.  Jessica sells food products, has a store in her home, and serves her customers there, most of whom are her own neighbors.  She likes her work because it allows her to her stay in the comfort of her own home and care for he son with no problems.  This will be her second loan through Kiva.  She is hoping for your help so that she can focus on her plans.  She will use the 600 PEN from this loan to buy food products such as rice, milk, fish products, and other things.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Annemete

texts.es: Annemete, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, esta divorciada y vive en compañía de sus 03 hijas de 12, 13 y 03 años de edad en su casa propia.Annemete se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros  y niños, de diversas marcas y modelos, los cuales trae a pedido , esta actividad la realiza de modo ambulatorio y a domicilio, ya lleva como 05 años en éste negocio, la cual lo realiza sola pero de manera muy alegre.Lo que le gusta de ésta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual pueda mantener a su familia. Tiene ganas de seguir trabajando y buscar un negocio rentable, por eso tiene planes de comprar un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros de mayor capacidad como una combi.Por tanto éste será el 01 préstamo con Kiva, se siente muy contenta con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de 800 soles comprará ropas de niños y damas para de esta temporada.
texts.en: Annemette is 34 years old. She is a happy person, dynamic and entreprenurial. She is divorced and lives in her own house with her 3 daughters, who are 12, 13, and 3 years old. Annemette sells a variety of clothing for women, men, and children, whoch she sells on request. She does this business through street sales and by going to people's houses. She has been in this business for 5 years. She works by herself, but she is cheerful. What she likes about this business is that it generates income for her so that she can support her family. She wants to continue working and find a business that will earn well. This is why she has plans to buy a large capacity passenger transport vehicle, such as a mini bus. This will be her first loan with Kiva. She feels very happy with the financial support she is receiving so that she can continue with her work. With the requested amount of 800 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles), she will buy seasonal clothing for children and women.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and women.

loans.name: Roca De Los Siglos Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita de estado civil casada, cuenta con 31 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. primaria, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de canastas, inició este negocio por enseñanza de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales para elaboracion de canastas. en el futuro desea tener un capital grande de trabajo para poder elaborar mas canastas y tener un local en el centro del municipio; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio. En la fotografía del grupo hace falta una integrante, puesto que esta señora no pudo asistir en la reunion cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Margarita is 31 years old and married. She went as far as third year of primary school and has four children, two of whom go to school. She makes baskets. She started this business having been taught it by her parents, and so far has 10 years of experience.

She decided to organize a group to apply for a loan, which she will use to purchase materials for making baskets. 

In the future she wishes to have a large amount of working capital so that she can make more baskets and have a shop in the center of the town. The other members of the group are vendors.

In the group photo, one member is missing, as this lady was not able to attend the meeting where they took the photo.

loans.use: To buy materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Vidjannagni Klistin

texts.fr: Vidjannagni Klistin âgé de 30 ans, est marié à Julienne une couturière. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Vidjannagni Klistin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Vidjannagni Klistin n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Vidjannagni Klistin vend du charbon de bois et du gasoil par la méthode distribution depuis dix ans ; ce qui lui permet subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Vidjannagni Klistin s'approvisionne au Nigéria. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Vidjannagni Klistin sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit précédemment obtenu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Vidjannagni Klistin is 30 years old. He is married to Julienne, a seamstress. They have three children, some of whom are in school. Vidjannagni Klistin lives together with his wife and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. Vidjannagni Klistin did not attend school. For 10 years, he has been selling charcoal and diesel fuel through a distribution system. This allows him to support his family. He stocks up in Nigeria. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Vidjannagni Klistin is seeking financial support from ALIDé for the second time. His prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Al-Tariq

texts.en:
Al-Tariq is 43 years old, married and the father of four children. He adores his family and works very hard to pay for expenses, so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Al-Tariq started his own business of selling artificial jewelry 15 years ago. He has a fair number of customers. He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to increase his supply so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the loan amount, he will purchase metal for manufacturing jewelry. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase metal for manufacturing jewelry.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: la clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 7 años, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granas básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. La clienta solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi ella  pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This client lives in her own home with her life partner and her seven year old son. She has worked growing corn and beans for many years and this has given her the experience necessary to tend to her crops. She sells what she harvests in the grain markets, and with her earnings that she brings in with her sales she is able to cover the household expenses. This client is applying for a loan in order to be able to improve the land where she plans to plant her seeds and purchase the necessary inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, compost, and other items. This will help her have strong harvests so she can make better sales and provide a greater level of economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to improve her land and purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Ekaterine lives in Kutaisi district with her 54-year-old father, Rolandi. Ekaterine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Ekaterine’s father is an artisan. He is working in construction and on house renovations on private orders. He earns about 250 GEL (Georgian Lari) per month, which is the only source of living for the family, and it’s rarely enough for food for them. 

Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ekaterine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Ekaterine will start trading in clothing. She will purchase clothes from Turkey at the wholesale price, bring them to her district and sell them with the price markup among the villagers. With this business, Ekaterine will earn a good profit, and she will be able to improve the family's living conditions. Part of the profit, she will use for reinvesting in the same business and try to expand it more.

loans.use: To start trading in clothing.

loans.name: Syeeda

texts.en:
Syeeda is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of six children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband is a brick seller. He purchase bricks and sells them in the market at a profitable price. This small business is the only source of income for the family. 

Syeeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of loan amount, her husband will purchase bricks and sell them in the main market. By doing so, he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business. Syeeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bricks.

loans.name: Ekhtiram

texts.en:
Ekhtiram is 28 years old. He lives in the small village of Bolnisi District with his wife, sister and parents. Ekhtiram requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where potatoes and haricot are grown. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ekhtiram requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ekhtiram has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Ekhtiram will purchase a minibus and begin to trade in fruits and vegetables. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and begin to trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 49-year-old business man who lives in Yei. He is married with five children between the ages of three and 16 years. All of them go to school. Joseph runs a general store, and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of SSP 1,500 to purchase more body lotions and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income. In five years, Joseph would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and transportation costs. Joseph says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for purchasing more items such as body and hair lotions, etc.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is a divorced woman with two children who are all still in school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale shop business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 26-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Since 2006, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family. Due to the increase in the demand of the customers, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 16 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the partnership and continuous support in lending to her loans.
