They are doing a tremendous work because her children are able to go about their studies without interruption, since she can always pay the loans back in small affordable installments. She will use this loan to pay for tuition of her two daughters in secondary school. She is an honest and loyal customer.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 38-year-old married man with five children aged 14,11, eight, six and one year. Four of his children attend school; he also looks after two dependents, who are his siblings. Moses operates a retail business in Kagadi town that deals in the sale of basic household commodities. He has been operating this business since 2009. He started it as a source of income to look after his family. He also practices agriculture on a small scale mainly growing maize and beans for commercial purposes.

Moses wants a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more stock of sugar, rice, soap, and the like so that he can meet the demands of his customers in his neighborhood, and therefore earn more returns from the business. His dream is to see the business expand, and also go into large-scale commercial agriculture.

His major challenge is the limited capital in the business and the seasons in the agricultural sector that affect his businesses.

loans.use: Buy more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 36 years old. He lives in the small village of Bolnisi District with his wife, parents, and aunt. Ramin’s parents and aunt are provided with a retirement pension. He requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products at local markets. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ramin requested loan from Credo to start a family business. Ramin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Ramin will purchase calves. After purchasing calves, he will raise them and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves and raise and resell them at higher price.

loans.name: Jenus

texts.en: Jenus, a 21-year-old, is a married entrepreneur living in Dolores, Clarin Misamis Occidental with his only child. He earns a living from his transport service business of almost two years. He earns PHP 6,000 a month. To improve the business, Jenus is borrowing PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to repair the existing motorcycle. Before long, he’s hopeful to have the opportunity to expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing motorcycle.

loans.name: Yorlene

texts.es: Yorlene, tiene la edad  de 37 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, una adecuada semilla de frijol que pueda tener un buen desarrollo y producción y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y fertilidad de los suelos que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yorlene, 37, is married and lives with her spouse and children, who are her top priority. With her loan she plans to buy fertilizers and good bean seeds so that will develop and produce well, and other products to apply to the seedlings so that they germinate properly. She will also pay laborers for the application of these products and assistance with the planting once the seedlings have developed. This will ensure that she does a good job. She wants to take advantage of the good climatic conditions and fertility of the soils that her region has for this crop, and also to put into practice her various years of experience in planting basic grains. She also wants to buy the best quality products so that her plantation develops well and is healthy so that she gets a good harvest, and has good production in the short term. She will use the income from the harvest for her family's wellbeing and their studies, and to meet some family goals as well as to invest more in her crops. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan that is easier and has a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Noe Armando

texts.es: Don noe vive en casa propia con su hija, su yerno y un nieto; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 8 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida,  don noe es un hombre dedicado a su labor y asi familia, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Noe lives in his own home with his daughter, son-in-law, and grandson. He owns a store where he sells staple goods such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. He has run this business for eight years, which has given him the sales experience he needs to obtain the best prices. His store is located in his residence in a busy locale, and he benefits from having many clients as his store is well stocked. Noe is a man who is dedicated to his work and his family. Like all good businessmen, Noe hopes to grow the business and make a new capital investment but he needs more funds. For this reason he has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase staple grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc. and provide greater economic stability for his family.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Regelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Regelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell-rice-grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks, farming rice, and renting farm machinery and equipment. Regelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her business.

Regelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses of buying and selling rice grains, raising ducks, farming rice, and renting farm machinery and equipment.

Regelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair and maintain machinery.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 35 years old. He lives in Khobi district with his wife and 10-year-old daughter. Teimuraz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
The family runs an agricultural business. They have a milking cow, pig, chickens, and a plot of agricultural land. The cow is milked to produce dairy products; from the pig, they sell piglets; and on the land they grow maize, which is sold seasonally. All the products are sold at the local markets.

Teimuraz is an invalid and his family gets an additional monthly pension from the local government institution. He requested a loan from Credo to start-up his family business. Teimuraz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Teimuraz will build a fish pool and purchase young fish. He will grow the fish and soon sell them at a good price to earn an income. This business will give Teimuraz an opportunity to earn additional income for the family to improve their living conditions and provide a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To build a fish pool and purchase young fish.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a 66-year-old woman and married with two children. She lives in Barangay 3, Tangub City earning PHP 2,000 a month from her fruit vending business in the market. In 2009, Faustina joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance and recently, she borrowed PHP 2,500 to purchase more varieties of fruits for sale. She plans to increase her capital in order to multiply her income for the better living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married with two children. His family happily lives in the village of Rizal, Delfin Albano, Isabela. In order for him to support the needs of his family, Elmer engages in rice farming. Elmer said that he perseveres because he wants his children to finish their college studies. To achieve that dream, he wants to further improve his farming activities. With that he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan so he can purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. Elmer prays that his loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is married and has three children. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as her major challenge. 

She is requesting KES 15,000 to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. 

To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture, selling goods in the local community. Michelle has been in her business for two years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Michelle is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, bottled products and spices for sale. In 2011, Michelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, bottled products, and spices for sale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 50 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, canned goods, shampoo, chips, bread, and noodles, etc. to sell in her grocery store business.

Regina has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, canned goods, shampoo, chips, bread, and noodles, etc to sell in her grocery store business.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has eight children. Hilario is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and paint for the fishing boat. With this, he will be able to improve his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Hilario dreams of making his fishing business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and paint for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Forty-three year old Vasil lives in Norio village, Gardabani district with his wife and two children (14 and 17 years old). Vasil requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. Vasil is a driver. He is working privately and transports cargo to earn a small monthly income. The family also has 30 chickens. They sell eggs at the local market and earn additional income for the family.
 
Vasil requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Vasil has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vasil will open a car washing center in his garden. He will purchase all the needed equipment and start washing cars. As Vasil is a very hard working man, he will try his best and work hard to make his business successful and profitable. The increased income will help Vasil and his family to improve their living conditions and have better life.

loans.use: To open a car washing center.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en: Mjeni is taking out another Kiva of KES 40,000. The previous loan enabled her to double her monthly income, which has been of great help to her family.  With the new loan, she wants to buy grocery stock and coconuts for resale. She appreciates the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Denis is still a single young man who lives in Kachanga trading center. He is a business man who deals in trading agricultural products specifically tomatoes and passion fruit. He buys these products from farmers before harvesting them and packs them and sells them to traders in Owino and Nakasero markets (these are major food markets in the city). He usually works six days-a-week and each day he works for seven hours.

He has been in this business since 2005 and so far he has acquired a motor cycle from it that helps to ease his transport. He started this business so that he can earn a living and also there was availability of market for these products. He has acquired this loan in order to add to his business by buying more passion fruit and tomato seedlings for planting. His dreams are to buy more motorcycles and build rentals in Kyesiiga trading center his home town.
In his business he encounters the following challenges: high transport costs for transporting these products to Kampala and unpredictable weather conditions, which affects these products. He describes himself as a hard working man and says that his businesses are still growing slowly at the moment due to limited working capital.

loans.use: To buy pesticides.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: Joselito earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He lives in the town of CPG, Bohol. Joselito has been in the business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income. Joselito is asking for a loan to buy spare parts such as tires, nuts, and bolts, and to pay for the repair and maintenance. Through this, he will be able to improve and maintain the working condition of his motorcycle and continue to use it as a source of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as tires, nuts, and bolts, and to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 42 years old and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Ritchel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell such as soap, canned goods, noodles, and chips, etc.

Ritchel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ritchel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell such as soap, canned goods, noodles, chips, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Jonlhing Lom Group

texts.en:
This is a five-member group and they called themselves “Jonlhing Lom” group. They live in the northeastern part of India in the state of Manipur.  Jonlhing, according to the Kuki folk tale, was a very beautiful girl. Her beauty spread far and wide and people from different and far off places came to 
see and admire her beauty. Her beauty was compared with the brightness of the sun and she was adored by all. Speaking of which, the group members truly represent the beauty and personality of “Jonlhing” in their work because they work tirelessly and continually, hoping to bring change to 
their life and the lives of many people around them. 

The profiled member is Neilhing who is on the extreme left of the picture with her right hand raised. She is 32 years of age and blessed with two sons and two daughters. They are a happy family and her husband has his own local electronics repair workshop in the village. He repairs all kinds of electronic gadgets in the village like cell phones, radios, TVs and tape recorders. But the money that he receives from the workshop is not enough to run the house and pay for the children's monthly school fees. So, Neilhing decided to open a tailoring shop in the village where she knits trousers, shirts and school uniforms. But still, this job is not enough to meet the expenses of the family, because she is able to get only a meager income from the tailoring shop. 

She said that with the loan from KIVA, she will be able to buy more fabric for garments so that she can knit more and sell more. She also said that in this way, she can take more orders in advance and doesn’t have to wait for the customers to go to the nearest town to get the fabric. This is also going to save a lot of time and money for the villagers and at the same time, people from the nearby villages will come to get the garments from her. In this way, she will earn more and save more for her family. 

She said that over the next 10 years, she wishes to buy a paddy field of her own where she can grow wheat, grain and some cash crops in the field. Not only that, she wishes to continue knitting and expand her tailoring shop. The other group members are engaged in many other income-
generating activities like raising piglets for sale, and opening shops in different location within the village.

She thanks KIVA for offering loans. The group members said that God has answered their prayers and for that reason, they all can fulfill what they had been dreaming of. They also thank WSDS for their endless support, and hope that KIVA and WSDS will continue to render their support in the years to come.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to make garments to sell

loans.name: Lelibeth

texts.en: Lelibeth runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol. This is the source of her income. Lelibeth is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soda, noodles, biscuits, soap and toiletries, snack foods and other items. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Lelibeth dreams of expanding her store in the future so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soda, noodles, biscuits, soap and toiletries, snack foods and other items

loans.name: Sarana

texts.en:
Sarana is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Sarana is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to pay's her laborers' salaries and buy coconut seeds.

Sarana has been farming coconut for six years and earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay her laborers' salaries and buy coconut seeds

loans.name: Germán Andrés

texts.es:
Germán es un joven de 22 años de edad, sueña en convertirse en un gran chef, pero es conciente que su condición económica no es la mejor, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse en cocina básica con el fin de comenzar a construir su sueño y tener en un futuro su propio restaurante.
Espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y gozar de una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Germán is 22 years old and dreams of becoming a great chef.  However, he is aware that he is not living in the best financial situation and so is applying for a loan to invest in training in basic cooking.  With this, he hopes to start making his dream a reality and to have his own restaurant in the future.

Germán hopes to improve his family's quality of life and to have better finances.

loans.use: to pay for training in basic cooking.

loans.name: Jason

texts.es: Jason es un joven de 26 años de edad, padre de familia y muy trabajador, nos  comenta que su anhelo es reparar su vivenda para evitar el pago de alquiler y aprovechar sus ingresos en otras prioridades, necesita reparar gran parte de su casa, para que quede habitable, debe cambiar el techo,reparar algunas paredes, arreglar el piso, hacer aceras y otros arreglos, para lo0garr easto solicita un millón de colones exactos (¢1.000.000, con este dinero comprará ceemento, zinc. piedra, arena, madera, clavos , etc. Nos cuenta Jason que se siente muy feliz con este financiamiento, ya que le urge repara su vivienda.
texts.en: Jason is 26 years old and is a father, and a very hard-working one.  Jason tells us that his biggest desire is to repair his home so that he does not have to pay rent and so that his income can be spent on other important things.  He needs to repair a big part of the house so that it can remain habitable.  He must change the roof, repair some walls, fix the floor and pavement and do other bits of work.  For this, Jason is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Colons, which he will use to buy cement, zinc, stone, sand, wood nails and more.  Jason tells us that he is very happy with this loan as he really needs to do these home repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a consultant specialised in creating and developing businesses.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Katherine de 33 años de edad, es una mujer entregada a su familia. En la actualidad se encuentra pasando por una difícil situación debido a que hace algunos meses le diagnosticaron cáncer de cerebro, por lo cual se encuentra en tratamiento médico.  A pesar de las circunstancias esta mujer aun tiene muchos proyectos por cumplir y hace todo lo posible para materializarlos. Desea crear una empresa dedicada a la elaboración y venta de cuadernos con mensajes bíblicos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de capacitarse en la creación de su negocio y posteriormente materializar su deseo.
Su mayor deseo es poder compartir más tiempo con su familia y tener la oportunidad de ver crecer sus hijos.
texts.en:
Katherine is 33 years old and is dedicated to her family.  She is currently facing difficult times as a few months ago she was diagnosed with brain cancer which requires treatment.  In spite of these difficult circumstances, Katherine still has many plans that she wants to live out and she is doing all that is possible in order to make the plans a reality.  Katherine wants to start a business making and selling notebooks with Bible messages inside.  For this, she is applying for a loan in order to pay for training on how to start her own business and, later, to start the business.

Katherine's biggest dream is to be able to spend more time with her family and to have the opportunity to see her children grow up.

loans.use: to pay for a consultant on starting her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela de 35 años de edad, labora como asesora de viajes en una agencia desde hace más de cinco años.
Asegura que la repostería es una de sus grandes pasiones pero debido al factor económico este sueño se vio relegado al olvido. Desde hace algunos meses viene realizando postres y tortas por encargo, lo que la ha motivado a independizarse y crear su propio negocio, pero manifiesta que primero quiere capacitarse para perfeccionar la técnica, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar un curso de preparación de bizcochos y cubiertas.
Sueña con tener una gran repostería y que se constituya como la número uno en su localidad.
texts.en:
Marcela is 35 years old and has been working in travel agency for more than five years.

She tells us that pastry-making is one of her big passions but, for financial reasons, this dream has always been left to one side.  For some months, though, Marcela has been making cakes and tarts on order and this has motivated her to become independent and create her own business.  However, she says that she first needs to do training in order to perfect her skills and that is why she is applying for a loan.  With the loan, she will pay for training in preparing pastries and cake toppings.

Marcela dreams of having her own pastry shop and becoming the number-one pastry chef in town.

loans.use: to pay for training in preparing pastries and cake toppings.

loans.name: Lisi

texts.es: Lisi, de 28 años de edad , esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 5 años respectivamente,con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Lisi consiste en la venta de sandalias, zapatos , zapatillas ,carteras , entre otros productos. Trabaja en forma ambulatoria en un mercado cerca de su casa además tiene un puesto en donde atiende su pareja, mientras ella sale a ofrecer su mercadería entre sus amigos, vecinos o clientes los cuales ha logrado consolidar durante los años que lleva realizando este trabajo. Lleva en este negocio más de 7 años y por fortuna le va muy bien.Se siente muy a gusto haciendo su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo se retribuye con los buenos ingresos que recibe, pero ella necesita de alguna ayuda adicional ya que quiere incrementar sus productos debido a la temporada navideña que ya se aproxima, su principal objetivo es que su negocio prospere tanto en infraestructura como en cantidad de mercadería para que pueda ofrece mayor variedad de artículos a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará más zapatos y sandalias..
texts.en: Lisi is 28 years old, she is married, and she has two children who are ages five and nine. They all live together in their own home. Lisi's work consists of selling shoes, sandals, slippers, purses, and other products. She works a street vendor in a market near her home. She also has a stand where her partner works while she goes out to offer merchandise to their friends, neighbors, and the clients they have been able to gather during the years they have been running their business for more than seven years. Fortunately it is going very well. She feels very happy doing her work because her efforts are repaid by the good income she makes, but she needs additional help now that she wants to expand her products in anticipation of the holiday shopping season that is coming. Her primary goal is that her business prosper in infrastructure as much as in the quality of her merchandise so that she can offer a greater variety of items to her customers. In this cycle she is requesting S/. 1500. She is very happy to know that she will have a source of financial support and to feel confident going ahead with her business. At the same time she promises to fulfill her payment obligations in a timely manner. With the amount she has requested she will purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.use: purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past two years, she has operated a goat meat business, selling to local neighbors. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of work.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase 12 goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 12 goats for resale.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 52 years old. He lives in the small village of Martvili District with his wife, daughter, parents and aunt. His parents and aunt are provided with a retirement pension. Gocha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and 0.8-hectare land, where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Gocha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Gocha will purchase a milking cow. After purchasing a milking cow, they will be able to produce cheese products to sell. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence operates a retail shop in Gangu, Kampala. She is a mother of three and married to a man who works with Posta Uganda. She is a hotelier by profession. She started this business because she was not earning enough money from the hotel she was working for.
Florence is a second time borrower and this time she is applying for UGX 2,500,000 (Two million five hundred thousand shillings). The purpose of this money is to add more stock to the business and expand it. Her future plan is to use the profits to expand her retail shop and make it a supermarket. She hopes the supermarket will generate more income to build a family house. Florence looks forward to a successful partnership with the Kiva lenders. In the photo is the Ugafode credit officer and Florence and her son.

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell bread business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 11 years. She also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy and sell bread business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero operates a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He cites seasonality and delayed payments as a challenge in the business.

With the KES 50,000 he wants to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and he appreciates the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar for his business.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 45 years old. He lives in Rustavi district with his 29-year-old wife Nino. Gocha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. Gocha’s wife Nino is a teacher at the local school and earns a small monthly salary of 300 Gel. This is the only source of living for them. 

Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Gocha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Gocha will purchase a mini-bus. He will start working on a bus line, Rustavi-Tbilisi. As Rustavi is very close to the capital city, a lot of people travel to Tbilisi every day. This bus line direction is in great demand and Gocha will have a lot of passengers every day. It will help him to earn a good income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 60 years old and married with three children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Nelia has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 62 years old and married with seven children. Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Julieta has been in this business for 34 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Manriama Folakèmi

texts.fr: Âgée de 39 ans, Manriama Folakèmi est mariée Pierre. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Manriama Folakèmi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Manriama Folakèmi a très peu fréquenté l'école. Manriama Folakèmi vend du maïs, des chaussures et des produits divers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Manriama Folakèmi s'approvisionne dans le nord Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Manriama Folakèmi sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Manriama Folakèmi, age 39, is married to Pierre. The couple has two school-attending children whom they have to support. In addition to their own children, they also have another child to support.

Manriama Folakèmi lives together with her husband and children. The couple makes sure together that the various family expenses are covered.

Manriama Folakèmi didn't attend school much. She sells corn, shoes, and various other products at her home. This enables her to provide for her family. She gets her supplies in Northern Benin.

In order to meet customer demand, she's for the first time seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and shoes

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlita is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Merlita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for fishing.

Merlita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for fishing

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon lives in Mbaaba Kiruhura district, an area known for cattle rearing. Little did he know that his destiny would be cattle rearing, as people used to mock herdsmen as being illiterate and academic failures. Things hardened up when Benon became a single father of three; he remained with no alternative apart from joining a cattle rearing business, a job that would give him time to look after his siblings at the same time and keep him close to the home. Benon’s hard work demystified all the fears he had in cattle rearing after realizing that he was even far better off than his friends who went to cities to look for better jobs. Benon has succeeded in buying a big chunk of land and increased his livestock. He now wants to buy more cattle to be put in his newly cleared farm. In order to do this he has applied for a loan from UGAFODE for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy cattle for his cattle rearing business

loans.name: Basilia Solange

texts.fr: Âgée de 50 ans, Basilia Solange est une veuve. Basilia Solange a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Basilia Solange vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Basilia Solange a très peu fréquenté l'école. Basilia Solange vend du maïs, de la farine de blé et du sucre à son domicile depuis dix ans ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de faire face à ses différentes charges. Basilia Solange s'approvisionne dans un marché au Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Basilia Solange sollicite pour la troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Basilia Solange, age 50, is a widow with three school-attending children to support. She didn't attend school much. She lives with her children.

Basilia Solange has been selling corn, wheat flour, and sugar at her home for ten years. This enables her to provide for her family and cover her various expenses. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

In order to meet customer demand, she's for the third time seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and various other products

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
26-year-old Irakli lives in Rustavi district with his 22-year-old wife, brother, and an infant son (1 year old). Irakli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family is out of a source of income at this moment. 
Irakli requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Irakli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Irakli will start trading in household goods. He will rent a counter at the local market and purchase stock of the products. Irakli’s mother used to work in this business before she passed away one month ago, so Irakli is already advised in this field. This will help him to make his business successful and profitable. He will earn an income for the family and they will be able to cover monthly expenses.

loans.use: To start trading in household goods

loans.name: Trifon

texts.es: El señor Trifon de 29 años, de estado civil soltero, vive en Colomi, en una casa en alquiler.El señor Trifon se dedica a la producción agrícola de locoto y papa, cultivando en terreno propio, con rotación de cultivos de la misma comunidad, a la vez nos cuenta que tuvo gastos con la compra de una motocicleta que lo utiliza para el traslado a su fuente laboral más una motosierra que da uso para realizar el chaqueo (preparación de terreno para la siembra), por este motivo él se apersono a nuestra Institución a solicitar un crédito para construcción de una vivienda.Finalmente él se siente muy feliz por haber tenido esta oportunidad ahora va tener su propia vivienda que vivirá muy feliz ya que actualmente vive en alquiler y es un gasto mas que tiene que cubrir cada mes pero gracias al crédito el tendrá un mejor ahorro a futuro.
texts.en: Trifon is 29 years old, single, and lives in a rented house in Colomi.  Trifon is a farmer and raises locoto and potatoes on his own farmland.  He sells in the same community.  He tells us that he had expenses for a motorcycle that he uses to transport his wares and a chainsaw that he uses to prepare his land for planting.  He has approached our institution for a loan so he can build a house.  He is very happy for having this opportunity and he will now have a house of his own where he will live happily.  He currently lives in a rented house and it’s one other expense that he has to cover each month, but thanks to the loan he will have a better future.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Zari

texts.en:
Zari is 45 years old and a hardworking mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and children. She is a very skilled woman and she is a real expert in stitching up dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for 10 years. All the people in her area are well satisfied and happy with her work. Zari provides her services at a very reasonable amount; that's why her work is increasing day by day.
Zari has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice was born in 1973, and she lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, has living conditions much better than the capital city of Liberia, and is the second most populous county in Liberia. Alice did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in a rural area. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have six children together, the ages of whom Alice said she does not know; none of her children are in school. 
From selling her husband's farm products, Alice was able to establish her business. From 2002 she has been running a small local shop where she sells slippers and clothes. She spends 9 hours at her business a day, from Monday to Saturday. One problem that Alice faces is a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory products for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory products for her business.

loans.name: Dúo El Libano Group

texts.es: Dúo Libano, este dúo esta conformado por la señora Rosa Irma de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de huevos desde hace varios años, esta muy agradecida con fape y kiva ya que con el credito anterios pudo comprar mas mercaderia y aumentaron sus ventas, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en Huevos ya que sus clientes le piden por mayo y entonces nececita mas capital para satisfacer a las nececidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: The Dúo El Libano group is comprised in part of Rosa Irma, who is 46 years old and has dedicated herself for various years to the sale of eggs. She is very happy with FAPE and Kiva because with the previous loan she was able to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales. For this reason she is requesting this loan to purchase more eggs as her customers order wholesale and she needs more funds in order to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: purchase wholesale eggs for retail sale.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 49 years old, and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, has living conditions much better than the capital city of Liberia, and is the second most populous county in Liberia. Kou did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have four children together between the ages of 2 to 27. Kou said only one of her children is in school, and they all live in the same house which was built by the children's father. 
With a little money from her husband, Kou was able to establish her tabletop business ten years ago, where she sells palm oil, salt, pepper etc. Kou spends 8 hours at her business per day, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is a small income. Kou is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a mineral water vending business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of mineral water to sell to her customers.

Thelma has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of mineral water to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is also a farmer. Leonora is married and has three children who are still attending school.
Leonora is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and fertilizer for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Leonora dreams of expanding her store, saving money for the schooling of her children, and also of repaying her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND 4 est composé de trois personnes qui sont vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Alimatou Sadia Ola est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Alimatou Sadia Ola est âgée de 35 ans. Alimatou Sadia Ola a très peu fréquenté l’école. Alimatou Sadia Ola est mariée à un certain Aliou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Alimatou Sadia Ola vit avec ses enfants. Alimatou Sadia Ola assiste son mari dans les charges de ménage. C'est pour cette raison que, Alimatou Sadia Ola vend du charbon de bois et du piment à son domicile depuis dix sept ans. Alimatou Sadia Ola s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Alimatou Sadia Ola sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND 4, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Dieu Est Grand 4 group is made up of 3 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Alimatou Sadia Ola, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Alimatou Sadia Ola is 35 years old and did not get much schooling. Alimatou Sadia Ola is married to Aliou. The couple have 2 children who both attend school. Alimatou Sadia Ola lives with her children and supports her husband with the household expenses. It is for this reason that Alimatou Sadia Ola has been selling charcoal and peppers from her home for 17 years. Alimatou Sadia Ola gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying her customers and increasing her sales and revenue, Alimatou Sadia Ola is requesting, together with the other members of the Dieu Est Grand 4 group, a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and peppers.

loans.name: Mahussi Olga Gertrude

texts.fr: Olga Gertrude Mahussi, âgée de 31 ans est mariée à Gratien. Le couple n'a pas enfant. Olga Gertrude Mahussi vit ensemble avec son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de ménage. Olga Gertrude Mahussi a très peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris l'imprimerie. Olga Gertrude Mahussi exerce ce métier depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Olga Gertrude Mahussi sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Olga Gertrude Mahussi is 31 years old and married to Gratien. The couple have no children. Olga Gertrude Mahussi lives together with her husband. The couple both take care of the various household expenses. Olga Gertrude Mahussi did not get much schooling but she did learn the business of printing. Olga Gertrude Mahussi has been in this line of work for 5 years, which enables her to meet her needs without too much difficulty. In order to satisfy her customer demand, Olga Gertrude Mahussi is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy printing paper.
